event: Russia's Increased Use of Air Bombs
description: Russia has significantly increased its use of air bombs in 2024, with a 16-fold increase compared to 2023. This surge in aerial attacks has hindered the Ukrainian Armed Forces' ability to stabilize the combat contact line, causing difficulties for the enemy.
original:
Forwarded from: The world today with "Yuri Podolyak"
Russia in 2024 uses 16 times more air bombs than in 2023... Moreover, it is obvious that this figure will only increase further. And this, in many ways, today does not allow the Ukrainian Armed Forces to stabilize the line of combat contact. As soon as our aviation begins to massively throw “cast iron” somewhere, things immediately start to go wrong for the enemy...

description: Rescuers are working to reach 13 miners trapped in a mine in the Amur region following a rock collapse. They have drilled a 71-meter exploratory well and plan to deliver underground drilling equipment and a high-precision drilling machine from Kuzbass to speed up the rescue efforts.
original:
Rescuers drilled a 71-meter exploratory well to reach miners at a mine in the Amur region. Underground drilling equipment will be delivered there, which will speed up the passage of the mine to determine the location of people. It is also planned to deliver a high-precision drilling machine from Kuzbass.

Let us remind you that after a rock collapse in the Amur region, 13 people were trapped in the mine under the rubble. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Fraudsters coerced a 47-year-old former employee of a gas station in Chekhov, near Moscow, into committing a robbery. The man, wearing a black mask and carrying a pneumatic gun, threatened the staff and stole approximately 85,000 rubles from the cash register. He was detained immediately after the incident.
original:
Fraudsters forced a 47-year-old resident of Chekhov near Moscow to rob a local gas station - with a phone on his body that was broadcasting online. The man put on a black mask, set off a firecracker and, threatening with a pistol, took about 85k from the cash register.
He was detained almost immediately - he had previously worked at the same gas station.
Show more
He confessed to the employees: unknown people called and said that a loan had been issued. But there is a solution: robbery. They gave instructions and the man made up his mind.
I secured the phone to my body with tape, made a video call, put on a mask and went. Then, threatening with a pneumatic gun, he cleaned out the cash register and ran away. Still broadcasting what is happening to the curators. A criminal case has been opened under the article of robbery.

description: Igor Naumenko, a resident of Novoglagolevo village, has been involved in illegal activities, including stealing 500 million rubles from investors meant for a sewerage system and polluting the environment. He has also been accused of arbitrariness, with over 50 statements filed against him to the police and prosecutor's office.
location: Novoglagolevo, Naro-Fominsk district, Moscow Oblast, Russia
original:
The hero of several publications of the Cheka-OGPU, Igor Naumenko, settled in the village of Novoglagolevo (Naro-Fominsk district, Moscow region) since the 90s, by now turning it into his feudal estate, and the buyers of million-dollar cottages into serfs.

In Glagolevo Park he is the boss, but Naumenko literally shits on the local and federal authorities. Having stolen 500 million from investors, intended for the construction of a sewerage system, Naumenko has been pouring waste into a forest stream for many years, which has become a stinking swamp, destroying the surrounding forest, then fecal slurry from 396 houses goes into the Pakhra River, and then into the Moscow River.

Now, a man who has lost his head from impunity declares that he can “make money” with any government, flaunts his friendship with the ex-chief of the Naro-Fominsk district police department, Colonel A.V. Ivanov. and the head of the Selyatino Department of Internal Affairs, K.I. Tarasov, and when it’s profitable - with the “Solntsevskaya lads”. Friendship is an abstract concept, but that the local police are supported by Naumenko is a fact.

The stronghold of the police of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Russian Federation of the now dismissed district police officer Popov was located in the building where I.V. Naumenko’s office was located; under what conditions he provided the premises is unknown. All statements from residents to the police on Naumenko were considered by the district police officer in his office, and then the applicants were invited there for conversations “humanly”, in the style of the nineties.

Over 15 years, residents of Glagolevo-Park wrote more than 50 statements to the police about the arbitrariness of Igor Naumenko, complaints to the prosecutor's office and an appeal to Governor Andrei Vorobyov, to the administration of the President of the Russian Federation, local TV filmed stories about Naumenko's arbitrariness. All in vain.

Naumenko's companies are the main contractors for the operation of the village of Novoglagolevo, providing services for the maintenance and development of the settlements included in it: Mishutkino, KP "Glagolevo-Park", Old Glagolevo, New Glagolevo, holiday villages "Rubin" and "Granite". His private security company collects illegal fees from residents for the entry of construction equipment into “his territory”, without any reporting, without showing accounting documents. Letter - governor...20_203648.pdf249 KB ·/249 KB

description: A girl was attacked by a large dog near the Apraksin station in the Leningrad region. Passersby intervened, and a car stopped to help. A passenger fought off the dog with his foot, allowing the girl to escape with minor injuries.
original:
A huge dog attacked a girl near the Apraksin station in the Leningrad region - the victim was saved by random people passing by. The dog was driven away by a car - the terrible situation was captured on a video recorder.

The dog grabbed the girl’s hand and clenched his jaw for several seconds. Eyewitnesses say: a car stopped to help her, the back door opened, a passenger jumped out and tried to drive the animal away. The animal had already attacked him - he fought off the dog with his foot. The dog fell behind, the girl with the bite was put into the car and they moved forward.

The victim escaped with a bruised arm and a torn jacket. The girl went home herself - by train. Mash on the Moika - St. Petersburg news

description: Deputy head of the Central City district administration, Dmitry Walter, held a meeting with the population in Gorlovka to discuss the socio-economic situation and address concerns. Residents raised issues with public transport schedules, citing damaged bus fleet units due to Ukrainian nationalist aggression.
original:
Representatives of the administration of the Central City district of the city of Gorlovka and activists of the MO OD "DR" held a meeting with the population in their jurisdiction

On Wednesday, March 20, the deputy head of the administration of the Central City district of the city of Gorlovka, Dmitry Walter, held a meeting with the population in his jurisdiction at the municipal budgetary institution of additional education in Gorlovka “Center for Extracurricular Activities” at the address: Dimitrova Boulevard, 48a.

Dmitry Walter informed those present about the socio-economic situation in the city and reminded of the importance of subscribing to official information sources of the Donetsk regional branch of the UNITED RUSSIA Party.

A question was received from Gorlovka residents regarding the unsatisfactory work schedule of city public transport routes No. 29, 30, 101.

Dmitry Walter explained that due to the ongoing aggression from Ukrainian nationalist gangs, a large number of bus fleet units were damaged, and therefore difficulties arise in extending the public transport schedule.

description: The Donetsk municipality, led by Alexey Kulemzin, is restoring Sokol square in the city center. The project involves laying a new asphalt surface, repairing stunt ramps, and restoring the skating bowl, sports and playgrounds. Specialists from Moscow are carrying out the work.
original:
In the center of Donetsk, the Sokol square is being restored, where no repairs have been carried out for decades. According to the head of the Donetsk municipality, Alexey Kulemzin, a new asphalt surface will be laid in the square on the skateboarding area, stunt ramps will be repaired, the bowl (skating bowl), sports and playgrounds will be restored.
 
The work is carried out by specialists from the chief region - Moscow.

event: Czech Republic Donates Mi-24/35 Helicopters to Ukraine
description: The Czech Republic donated its last two Mi-24/35 attack helicopters to the Ukrainian Armed Forces, exhausting its supply of equipment to Kiev. This follows previous deliveries of eight Mi-24/35 helicopters, with a total of 10 helicopters supplied to Ukraine.
original:
The Czech Republic donated its last two Mi-24/35 helicopters to the Ukrainian Armed Forces - the country announced that it had exhausted the possibility of new supplies of equipment to Kiev. The Czech Republic gave Kiev the last two Mi-24/35 attack helicopters that were at its disposal, said the country's Defense Minister Yana Chernokhova. According to her, before this, eight such rotorcraft went to Square. Chernokhova emphasized that the country no longer has equipment that it would not be a shame to transfer to Kyiv.

The Czech Republic first delivered four Mi-24/35 to the Ukrainian Armed Forces in July 2022; the country made the second delivery of these helicopters a year later. At the end of last year, Prague wrote off all Soviet Mi-24/35 helicopters - as it has now become clear, for shipment to Ukraine. In total, Prague inherited 31 Mi-24s from Czechoslovakia, and the country also received 17 Mi-35s from Russia in the 90s as part of paying off the Soviet debt. The Czech Republic supplied some of these vehicles to the Afghan army long before the conflict in Ukraine.

"Readovka"

event: Decrease in Russian Arms Imports to Algeria
description: According to the Stockholm Peace Research Institute (SIPRI), Algeria's purchases of Russian weapons have decreased by 83% since 2018. Despite allocating a significant defense budget of over $20 billion last year, Algeria's overall arms imports have declined by 77% between 2019 and 2023.
original:
🇩🇿🇷🇺Algeria’s purchases of Russian weapons have decreased by 83% since 2018. Experts from the Stockholm Peace Research Institute (SIPRI) came to this conclusion. Moreover, between 2019 and 2023 (compared to the previous four years), the rate of decline in arms imports into Algeria overall reached 77 percent.

At the same time, Algeria allocated huge budgets for the acquisition of new weapons. The defense budget it allocated last year exceeded $20 billion, which is a very large figure for an African country.Arab Africa

description: In the Perm region, paleontologists discovered the Makhnevsky Caves, containing 8 karst grottoes and caves with deposits formed 128-115 thousand years ago. The caves hold significant importance for studying species composition and structure of faunas from the late Pleistocene and Holocene periods.
original: In the Perm region, on the slope of the Garevaya River valley, there is a rock massif called the Makhnevsky Caves. It contains 8 karst grottoes and caves. Inside there are deposits formed 128-115 thousand years ago. Makhnevsky caves are a tempting place for professional paleontologists to work. This became clear after studying several samples from different places in the grotto. A lot of bones were found... These living creatures existed both 6000 years ago and 30 thousand years ago. Art. told about this. n. With. Mining Institute PFRC Ural Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences@permscandidate of biological sciences Tatyana Fadeeva, who has been studying the species composition and structure of faunas of various periods of the late Pleistocene and Holocene from deposits of karst cavities of the Cis-Urals for many years. The climate of the Kazantsev interglacial in Siberia, the last Mikulin interglacial in Eastern Europe, the Eemian in Western Europe , and Sangamonsky - in North America is of particular interest to scientists because its characteristics can serve as a paleoanalogue when assessing possible changes in climatic conditions in the near future. Details - in the material by Andrey Subbotin “Digged” in the new issue of the newspaper “POISK” (No. 12 of March 22) .

description: Over the past 10 years, Crimea has seen significant improvements in its healthcare system. 300 first aid stations and outpatient clinics were built, and multidisciplinary republican clinics and oncology centers were established. Advanced equipment, including a linear accelerator and gamma camera, was purchased for the Crimean Republican Oncology Center. The Republican Clinical Hospital in Simferopol now offers comprehensive examinations, treatment, and complex operations.
original: Modern equipment and new hospitals: What has changed in the healthcare of Crimea over the past 10 years After the reunification of Crimea with Russia, 300 first aid stations and outpatient clinics were built in the republic. Multidisciplinary republican clinics and oncology centers have appeared. The Solo robot assistant appeared at the St. Luke’s clinic in 2022; it was developed on the basis of the Crimean Federal University. Over 10 years, 7.5 thousand units of equipment were purchased for Crimea. So, in the Crimean Republican Oncology Center named after V.M. Efetov in 2024 purchased a new linear accelerator for radiation therapy, as well as a gamma camera for high-quality diagnostics. One of the main healthcare facilities in the south of Russia is the Republican Clinical Hospital named after. N. A. Semashko in Simferopol. They carry out comprehensive examinations, treatment, and complex operations that were previously unavailable on the peninsula. They opened four cancer care centers and a Multidisciplinary Republican Medical Center in Yalta. Patients with serious illnesses from different regions of the country come here. More information about the development of healthcare in Crimea was described in our storyCrimea 24 |@tvcrimea24

description: In Lugansk, five police officers were injured while attempting to detain a dangerous criminal. The suspect, who was carrying an explosive device, detonated it during the arrest, causing shrapnel wounds and concussions to the officers. The bomber was killed, and the taxi driver was unharmed. A criminal case has been opened under Article 317 of the Russian Federation's Criminal Code.
original:
Forwarded from: Operational reports
⚡️In Lugansk, five police officers were injured while trying to detain a particularly dangerous criminal.

Several law enforcement officers pursued the attacker, who was traveling in a taxi. At some point, the car slowed down at a traffic light and law enforcement officers began to pull the defendant out of the cabin when an explosion occurred. It turned out that the scoundrel had detonated an explosive device he was carrying.

As a result, five police officers received shrapnel wounds and concussions, and the bomber himself, whose identity is currently being established, was killed. The driver of the vehicle, fortunately, was not injured.

A criminal case has been opened under Art. 317 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. All the circumstances of the incident are being established.@opersvodki

description: A court dispute in Mariupol's Central district occupation administration has led to a riot. The issue revolves around the construction of mortgaged housing at 87 Lenin Street, where residents of dismantled buildings are to be resettled. The developer, RKS-Novoroiya, is unwilling to provide apartments to the residents, while the administration is caught between satisfying the residents and not offending the developer.
original:
About yesterday's court riot. Reasons, consequences and why something happened to the breadwinner in the occupation administration. In mid-February, the head of the district occupation administration of the Central (October in the occupiers) district of Mariupol, O. V. Kiryakulov. informed the residents of the dismantled buildings at 75b Myru (House with a clock), 77 Myru, and 47 Metalurgiv that: Morgun has applied for the construction of mortgaged housing at 87 Lenin Street, where they are supposed to be resettled. As they say in the pseudo-administrations, for p#zdlyvykh 75, 77 and 47 houses, at the same time, the order regarding the provision of the land plot to the developer, signed by Pushylin, is being contested in court. On the basis of this order, the administration of the city of Mariupol allocated this site.
But since on the one hand, the beneficiary of RKS-Novoroiya (read FSB+Marat Khusnuulin), and on the other "p#zdlyvye 75, 77 and 47", who complained to Putin's control - the twine is still the same.
They have to somehow simultaneously satisfy the residents without offending the developers. And the developer does not want to give Mariupol residents a single apartment. Therefore, how to untie the Gordian knot - khz. The administration on the sidelines insists on simply arresting and deporting the FSB's "criminals 75, 77 and 47" as if they don't mind, but on the other hand, there may be a "hello" from Putin's administration through Pushilin.
In short, if you ever need an example of congitive dissonance, this situation is the best. Ah yes. About the "Russian breadwinner". Let's look at the document (complaint) and what do we see? Right. "our house was destroyed by an airstrike." For now, this is the first and so far the only direct statement of Mariupol residents on paper during the occupation about the destruction of the city by aerial bombs. So Russian, bread?

description: Veterans of the Union of Submariners of the Pacific Fleet handed over the foundation board of a Walrus-class submarine to the Military History Museum of the Pacific Fleet. original:
Veterans of the Union of Submariners of the Pacific Fleet (Pacific Fleet) handed over the foundation board of one of the first Walrus-class submarines of the Russian Empire to the Military History Museum of the Pacific Fleet.

Chairman of the Union of Submariner Veterans, Reserve Vice Admiral Alexander Konev, handed over the foundation board to the head of the museum, Evgeny Zhuravlev, during a ceremonial meeting at the House of Fleet Officers.

The unique item will join the museum’s collection and will be shown to the public during the planned thematic exhibition.

The mortgage board is made of a silver plate on which is stamped the silhouette of a Walrus-class submarine. It was made as a souvenir for family members of the royal family.⚓️t.me/TOF_VMF

description: German AfD party members, who observed the Russian presidential elections, appeared on RT as experts on democracy. This has raised concerns in Germany, where RT lost its broadcasting license in 2022.

The German newspaper Die Tageszeitung is poisoning four members of the AfD party - they were observers at the presidential elections in the Russian Federation, and then came on RT.
The article complains that politicians have "played their part" on "propaganda" television.
Show more
RT lost its license to broadcast in EU countries in 2022, but this did not stop German observers, the publication worries: “Ulrich Singer told RT after the elections that he and other deputies were invited [on air] as experts on democracy.”
Now the share of AfD politicians on German television is only 1.7% of all parties in the Bundestag, as calculated by the private German company Statista, which analyzes various databases.
At the same time, according to the latest results of a survey by the independent German institute INSA, the party is supported by at least 19.5% of the country's citizens

They also included prayed icons and fabric for camouflage nets, and donated 2 thousand rubles to the collection account.
original:
“We are praying for them: grandmothers from Vladikavkaz collected parcels for the fighters.”
To the project "Popular Front. Everything for Victory!" Vladikavkaz resident Elena Ktsoeva joined. For our fighters, my grandmother knitted 10 pairs of warm socks and wrote a letter with words of support.
Show more
During the Great Patriotic War, Elena's family suffered greatly from the fascist evil spirits. Her father and uncles did not return from the battlefields. Elena wishes all the children to return to their mothers.
Townspeople Taisiya Bigaeva and Ekaterina Efremova made their contribution to the collection of assistance. Women collected canned food, tea products and sweets to the front line.
In the parcels they put prayed icons, fabric for camouflage nets, and also asked to transfer 2 thousand rubles to the collection account. Grandmothers worry about each of our fighters and constantly pray.
Thanks for support! We will definitely pass on everything.
#BehindUsTruth #WeDon’t Abandon Our Own

description: The Donetsk region is facing a significant challenge with at least 100,000 hectares of forests contaminated by unexploded shells and rockets, as well as mined. The head of the Donetsk Regional State Administration of Forestry and Hunting, Viktor Storozhenko, highlighted the severity of the situation, stating that thousands of hectares are polluted with explosive objects, including unexploded shells and grenades.
original:
‼️Almost half of the forests of Donetsk region are dangerous: how demining is progressing and whether there is recovery in the conditions of war

The Donetsk region is facing World Forest Day in 2024 in a difficult state. At least 100,000 hectares of forests are considered contaminated by unexploded shells and rockets, as well as mined.

"Thousands of hectares, tens of thousands, are polluted in our country... If you take all the forest farms that are now there, it will definitely be at least 100 thousand hectares. It is not only minefield, but also littered with explosive objects. Unexploded shells, grenades, etc. are lying around in our forests. When shelling began, not all shells exploded. Some are lying down and can break at any moment," says Viktor Storozhenko, head of the Donetsk Regional State Administration of Forestry and Hunting.

description: Russian political strategists, party representatives, public figures, and journalists gathered in Moscow for a 12-hour marathon to discuss the country's first voting results. The event featured round tables, live broadcasts, and interviews, focusing on the electoral process in historical regions and the role of media in shaping public opinion.
original:
“Election Night 2024”: performed at the country’s main online political marathon!
On March 17, the best Russian political strategists, representatives of political parties, public figures and journalists gathered at a site in the center of Moscow. The 12-hour marathon allowed us to discuss
Show more
The main topic of the meeting was to observe both “here” and “now” the first voting results of the country’s residents.
Personally, I performed at several venues. Firstly, he hosted the event on the main stage for two hours. Secondly, I took part in two round tables at once.
One of them is “Media without dirt: how to overcome the minefield of the electoral cycle.” Here I talked about modern heroes of Russia, whose exploits need to be covered on federal channels, and not only on social networks and in the media of new entities, as well as about how the media sphere works in historical regions.
In the abstract - what I noticed:
Returning regions set trends in coverage of the electoral process. Residents came to vote not only in families, but also in entire teams; a festive atmosphere reigned in the cities themselves.
In historical regions, it was necessary to create from scratch not only a system of public administration, but also the media. Now effective media works there.
A new journalism is being born in the returning regions. They illuminate everything. Very young girls enter the profession at the age of 14-15, not afraid of being photographed, introducing their names and traveling to dangerous places. We see heroes all the time on social networks. For example, stories about how a 9-year-old boy Zhenya saved his sister in Belgorod; As the chairman of the territorial election commission of Donetsk, Margarita Tarbaeva, who commanded a female tank crew, works in dangerous conditions and helps her land make a historic choice.
The second round table is “Elections in historical territories: discussion of experts and military officers.” Here I acted as a moderator, and we talked with colleagues about turnout in elections in our new regions.
By the way, I spoke about how festive the voting was there during the live broadcast of the Puppies Media project, which was held with the support of the New Media Workshop. There he also explained why residents of historical regions were active and approached the event as responsibly as possible. Details are in the attached videos.
During the break, he gave an interview to colleagues from federal channels and told how the enemy “works” in connection with the successes of our country, and why we do not succumb to various provocations.
He noted that our enemies lost the fight for the minds of people and turned to terror, but achieved the opposite effect - the unity of our people. The high turnout in new regions and Belgorod showed this, because the best response to terror is to make an act that allows you to choose the future. In the most dangerous district of Donetsk - Kirovsky - people actively voted in teams and went to the polls with flags.
The enemy's fakes are not at all witty. Our work (including the OP of the Russian Federation) has allowed people to develop immunity to fakes. The West is not achieving anything big, and it has moved on to petty dirty tricks in the form of filling ballot boxes with green stuff by the hands of people intoxicated by the Ukrainian special services. And it doesn't work. We proved to the whole world that Russia is ahead of the rest in terms of our digital services, which helped us take part in voting remotely.
Returning to the pleasant moments, I would like to say that at Election Night 2024 I had a good meeting with the Chairman of the Central Committee of the Communists of Russia party, Sergei Malinkovich. He called me one of the best domestic journalists and social activists working in new regions, and noted my materials from there. Nice.
And I can’t help but mention the bright and interactive part of the busy day. I took part in a quiz on the history of elections, which was conducted by Alexey Blinov, a St. Petersburg resident, two-time winner of the “Crystal Owl” in the game “What? Where? When?". And... I won! I received a set of interesting books as a prize - now I’ll take them to #NewRegions
They did such a great job not only for #elections2024, but also on the night of summing up their results)

The Russian national football team defeated the Serbian team in a friendly match with a score of 4:0. The meeting took place at the VTB Arena in Moscow.

The goals scored were Anton Miranchuk (22nd minute, from the penalty spot), Maxim Osipenko (32), Alexey Miranchuk (55) and Ivan Sergeev (90+1).

Photo: Mikhail Tereshchenko/Mikhail Sinitsyn/TASS

description: Former US President Donald Trump is concerned about potentially inheriting Alzheimer's disease from his father, but has not publicly acknowledged it due to his criticism of Joe Biden's mental abilities. Trump has taken a dementia detection test twice and is willing to take another if Biden does the same.
original:
🧠Donald Trump is afraid of Alzheimer's disease Former US President Donald Trump fears that he could have inherited Alzheimer's disease from his father, but does not admit it, since one of his main arguments in the presidential race is Biden's mental abilities, writes the Washington Post.

The publication refers to a former top manager of the Trump Organization.

Trump himself has repeatedly stated that he has taken a test to detect signs of dementia twice and that he is ready to take another one if Joe Biden does it with him.

description: Poroshenko criticized the Ukrainian Ministry of Defense for constructing less than 10% of the necessary fortifications, despite claims of progress. He accused the government of failing to deliver on its promises, echoing past instances of corruption and mismanagement.
original:
Forwarded from: Readovka explains
You are not ready: Poroshenko criticizes the pace of construction of defensive structures for the Ukrainian Armed Forces After the bloody clown Zelensky was able to dismiss his key competitor, Commander-in-Chief Zaluzhny, and give Poroshenko and his team a crash course on “Who’s the Boss,” the Ukrainian opposition became silent , waiting for a new opportunity to strike. Against the backdrop of failures at the front, growing dissatisfaction with forced mobilization and a lack of funding “from under the bunk”, cautious voices of critics began to be heard. Either Klitschko, through his brother, presents himself to the Germans as an alternative candidate, then Poroshenko today from the podium The Rada accuses the Ministry of Defense of the fact that over the entire period less than 10% of the necessary fortifications were built: “Fortifications are 2,000 kilometers long... Ask the government how many percent were put into operation, and it will be less than 10%.” But what about the bravura videos with one bunker and hundreds of meters of trenches? You can remember Yatsenyuk’s famous “wall” from the distant pre-war times: stealing from fortifications in Ukraine is a national sport. Another thing is that it’s too early to throw caps up and throw hats at the enemy. Yes, Zelensky’s state program for the construction of fortifications failed, but the positions of the Armed Forces of Ukraine are still well fortified and without additional engineering structures. Instead of bunkers, there are basements and residential buildings. Instead of anti-tank ditches there are waste heaps, rivers and ravines. Instead of anti-tank hollows there are soggy black soils. And the trenches are dug with their own hands by the Ukrainians who want to live.

So the Square authorities continue to do business on the blood of their own soldiers—nothing new. We wish the RF Armed Forces good luck in overcoming those enemy fortifications that exist. Soon the rate of production of one and a half ton bombs from the UMPC will reach the point where it will be possible to drop off a couple of such gifts for each opornik. And then dig in, don’t dig in - the result is the same.

event: Shotguns Used Against Drones in Ukraine
description: Shotguns are becoming a leading means of defense against drones on the battlefield in Ukraine. They offer advantages such as ease of operation, low cost, and wide availability. The 12-gauge shotgun is commonly used due to its balance of power and recoil. However, limitations include limited range and the need for visual contact with the target, as well as safety concerns in densely populated areas.
original:
How shotguns are becoming the leading means of defense against drones on the battlefield in Ukraine - analysis by Army Recognition. Basic moments:

- Shotguns, which fire small pellets at a target, allow the shooter to hit a wider area with a single shot, making them many times more effective than conventional small arms such as machine guns.

- Other advantages of shotguns in the fight against drones: ease of operation and maintenance, wide availability of such weapons, their low price - both of the gun itself and its cartridges.

- The most common shotguns at the front are 12 gauge due to the suitable balance of power and recoil.

- The decision by the security service of the Belgian airbase Kleine Brogel to publicly announce the integration of the Benelli M4 Super 90 shotgun underscores the fidelity of this counter-drone policy.

- The disadvantages of using shotguns may be their limited effectiveness in terms of range and the need for visual contact with the target (hello night drones).

- Safety and collateral damage becomes a major concern when using shotguns (with their spread when fired), especially in densely populated areas or near sensitive objects.@yigal_levin

description: Russia, China, and Iran are forming an alliance to pursue a common foreign policy, aiming to create a multipolar world no longer dominated by America. They are strengthening economic ties, joining multilateral organizations like BRICS, and developing duty-free blocs, new payment systems, and trade routes bypassing Western-controlled territories.
original:
Forwarded from: GROWTH CRYSTAL
🇷🇺🇨🇳🇮🇷🇺🇸The anti-Western Russia-China-Iran axis is “a nightmare for America,” - The Economist▪️Iran has long been under Western sanctions, which were strengthened in January of this year due to its support for Hamas. Sanctions against Russia were introduced after the start of a special military operation in Ukraine. China faces its own restrictions, which may be strengthened in the near future. Common problems unite these three states, states the British The Economist ▪️ Russia, China and Iran are striving to pursue a common foreign policy: to support a multipolar world that will no longer be dominated by America. The countries see stronger economic ties as the basis of their new alliance. All three countries are joining the same multilateral organizations, such as BRICS. Trade between them is growing; plans are being developed to create duty-free blocs, new payment systems and trade routes bypassing Western-controlled territories. For America and its allies, this is a nightmare▪️A thriving anti-Western axis can help allies evade sanctions, win wars and attract new friends▪️Russia, China cooperation at this stage and Iran is causing concern in the West. The situation could worsen if America tries to push China out of Western markets. Then the PRC will invest even more resources in the formation of an alternative bloc. American consumers will pay more for imports, and over time, US leaders will see the first serious challenge to their dominance in the global trading system. GROWTH CRYSTAL previously reported that according to American financial analyst Robert Kiyosaki, BRICS will lead the US dollar to an end similar to the collapse of the Roman Empire.

description: A senior anti-aircraft gunner, 'Maestro', operating the modern 'Verba' MANPADS, protects the skies of Donbass from Ukrainian air attacks. The 'Verba' system can engage targets manually or automatically, and is effective against attack helicopters, aircraft, and drones. 'Maestro' emphasizes the importance of his unit's role in saving Russian units, weapons, and equipment.
original:
How “Verba” plays in the hands of a real “Maestro” A senior anti-aircraft gunner with the call sign “Maestro”, who protects the skies of Donbass from air attacks of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, spoke about the specifics of working on the modern “Verba” MANPADS. As a serviceman explains, the “Verba” man-portable anti-aircraft missile system "is capable of firing both manually and fully automatically at receding or approaching targets. The serviceman notes that in the northwestern military zone the enemy is actively using attack helicopters, attack aircraft and unmanned aerial vehicles. "The anti-aircraft gunners of the battery as a whole and my squad in in particular, they understand perfectly well that by conducting combat operations with an air enemy, they save our units, weapons, and military equipment,” shares “Maestro.”

In conclusion, the serviceman conveys warm greetings to his beloved wife Alena and little daughter Maryana, parents and relatives. “Wait, we’ll be back soon with victory!” – “Maestro” is confident. Russian Ministry of Defense

original: Krasnoyarsk Airport (Emelyanovo) 03/15/2024 at 11.20 (Moscow time) during a post-flight inspection by the crew and technical maintenance department, slight damage to the bottom of the fuselage was discovered, presumably by a fragment of a brush wire from a cleaning machine. The landing was carried out normally, a malfunction was detected on the ground. Airplane ATR-72-212A, RA-67610, flight 130, Tomsk - Krasnoyarsk. Operator: KrasAvia JSC.

event: Russian Armed Forces' Tactics to Break Through Front
description: Military expert Alexei Leonkov revealed that the Russian command will employ tactics to mislead the Ukrainian Armed Forces, hiding the real vectors of massive offensives to achieve operational-tactical success. The surprise factor is crucial, as seen in the Avdeevka operation, where Western media predicted a different target.
original:
A military expert spoke about the tactics of the Russian Armed Forces to break through the front this coming summer. The EU announced a difficult situation on the battlefield for Ukraine due to the offensive of the Russian Armed Forces. Deputy director of the Europe and Central Asia program at the International Crisis Group (ICG), Alyssa de Carbonnel, expressed fears that this summer the situation at the front could turn in favor of Russia.

According to military expert Alexei Leonkov, in order to successfully carry out upcoming operations, the Russian command will mislead the Armed Forces of Ukraine, carefully hiding the real vectors of massive offensives. “Our command has a strategic initiative. That is, we can make a breakthrough on any section of the line of combat contact. The surprise factor is one of the most important. Before Avdeevka, Western media said that we would take Kupyansk, but Avdeevka happened. The enemy will not wait, and then we will have operational-tactical success. We are misleading the enemy. Let them play a guessing game. In the place where they [the Ukrainian Armed Forces] least expect a breakthrough, this breakthrough happens,” Leonkov said in an interview with Paragraph. Subscribe to Paragraph

Forwarded from: Criminal Russia
In Chekhov, near Moscow, a man broke into the gas station where he previously worked and took 85 thousand rubles from the cash register. After his arrest, the robber said that he committed the crime at the instigation of scammers. They called him and introduced themselves as secret service workers.

The man was convinced that a large loan had been issued to him. To pay it off, he must rob a gas station, broadcasting what is happening online using his phone.

A criminal case of robbery has been opened.

description: Latvia faces an elevator crisis due to sanctions, affecting 8,300 elevators, including 3,500 produced in former USSR countries, mainly Belarus. Spare parts cannot be ordered from the manufacturing country, and replacing elevators is too costly.
original:
Latvians will be left without elevators due to sanctions. Now there are about 8,300 elevators in Latvia, of which 3,500 were produced in the countries of the former USSR, including about 2,500 in Belarus. Due to sanctions, it is currently impossible to order spare parts from the manufacturing country. And completely replacing the elevator is too expensive.

The case when they wanted to “punish” Russia and Belarus, but created problems for their residents, writes channel 360.

description: The Sevastopol government has increased the maximum staffing level of government employees supported by the city budget by 148 positions. The new positions include medical offices at new sports facilities, employees of these sports facilities, and additional MFC employees.

There will be 148 more public sector employees in Sevastopol. The Sevastopol government has increased the maximum staffing level of government employees supported by the city budget by 148 positions.

Positions have been created for medical offices at new sports facilities and for employees of these same sports facilities, and the number of MFC employees has also been increased. So, the staff of the pool named after. The 200th anniversary will have 79 staff positions.

“All this, of course, will require additional funds, but we knew all the activities that they would be carried out, so we planned expenses when forming the budget,” emphasized the head of the Department of Finance, Alexey Plotnikov.

description: Border defenders are learning from Donbass veterans. Conscript paratroopers, who previously fought against Ukrainian terrorists, are training 24/7 at the initiative of their commanders. They are honing their skills at the training grounds, including with experienced veterans of hostilities in Donbass. Mobilized soldiers are also taking classes at the Mongoose military center, where they receive military skills and fire training.
original:
03/21/24. Video from the WarGonzo channel.
“Border defenders are learning from Donbass veterans
Events on the border with the Belgorod and Kursk regions showed us that full-scale military operations are possible not only somewhere under
Show more
Bakhmut or Avdeevka. We also saw that our group of troops is quite ready for such a development of events. Just remember those same conscript paratroopers who entered into battle with Ukrainian terrorists and emerged victorious. And victory, as you know, loves preparation.
Real commanders understand this, and therefore force their soldiers to train 24/7. We managed to find out that the conscripts of the Airborne Forces, who took part and distinguished themselves during the breakout attempt in Tyotkino, regularly trained on the initiative of the command at the training grounds. Including experienced veterans of hostilities in Donbass. The systematic work carried out brought results.
Mobilized soldiers stationed on the nearby lines also take classes from instructors at the Mongoose military center, where they teach military skills and fire training in various areas to all interested military personnel.”

description: A resident of a Belgorod high-rise building recounted the aftermath of Ukrainian shelling, describing a scene of destruction with broken cars, shattered windows, and screams. The resident and their family took shelter in the bathroom. Emergency services responded swiftly, arriving within five minutes.
original:
“When I came out, I saw a pile of garbage, broken cars, plastic windows lying on the asphalt. And a lot of screams.” A resident of a Belgorod high-rise building damaged by Ukrainian shelling told RIA Novosti how he and his family were hiding in the bathroom.

According to him, the operational services arrived at the scene of the shelling as quickly as possible - not even five minutes had passed.

“A full fill of 50-70 glasses. They take everything away at once. And the whole day is idle,” the coffee shop owner complains and threatens to hand over the video to the juvenile affairs inspectorate and the prosecutor’s office.

description: Cadets attended a mine danger class, learning about common types of mines and explosive devices used by the enemy, their characteristics, and how to identify them. They were taught what to do when encountering unexploded cluster submunitions and how to avoid minefields.
original:
On Saturday (03/16/2024), in addition to fire training classes, we had an equally important mine danger class. It’s no secret that in the area where the air defense is being carried out, along with shrapnel wounds, mine-explosive injuries are common.
During the lesson, the cadets learned what the most common types of mines and explosive devices used by the enemy look like, their characteristics, and what “surprises” the enemy can leave in the liberated territories. We touched upon the current topic of unexploded cluster submunitions, and explained to the guys what to do when encountering them.
They explained what to do if suddenly a soldier was unlucky and found himself in a minefield, as well as external signs that unmasked installed explosive devices.
Well, of course, they conveyed the most important rule for working with discovered explosive devices - you didn’t set it up, it’s not yours to remove! Sapper games end very badly.#Engineering_training#Rokot#Barnaul|Sign up for classes|
|We are in VKontakte|

description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov celebrates his birthday on March 21. He is known for his unique style, combining flexibility, firmness, and strategic thinking. original:
Forwarded from: Maria Butina
“Only a beginner is allowed to lose his head when he first encounters an insurmountable dead end and gives up. And, thank God, I have seen a lot over the decades of diplomatic service. Patience, which is necessary for any person, is especially valued in our profession. It's hard to piss me off. But it’s not worth checking” - Sergei Lavrov. Today, March 21, the head of the Russian diplomatic corps, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation Sergei Viktorovich Lavrov, celebrates his birthday. It combines the flexibility of Alexander Gorchakov, the firmness and determination of Andrei Gromyko and the strategic thinking of Yevgeny Primakov, decorated with the cherry on the cake - Lavrov’s unique style.

Over the years of work in his post, Sergei Viktorovich managed to strengthen old and build new international relations, influence the strengthening of global peace and security.

Within the framework of the International Affairs Committee, we constantly cooperate with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Thanks to his high professionalism, wisdom and dedication to his work, Sergei Viktorovich achieved deep respect and recognition not only from colleagues from Russia, but also from prominent foreign delegates. And his elegance, sharp humor and charisma win the hearts of ordinary people around the world!

I express my personal gratitude to Sergei Viktorovich for all the efforts he made to help me return to my homeland. Your contribution to helping citizens in trouble abroad is invaluable.

Sergey Viktorovich, please accept our sincere congratulations! We wish you new diplomatic victories, significant meetings, good health, prosperity to you and your loved ones!

description: A criminal case has been opened against Verkhoturov for fraud, accused of illegally enriching himself by depriving low-income individuals of housing. He has been carrying out these schemes since 2017, often targeting vulnerable citizens, including an orphan girl and the elderly parents of an SVO soldier.
original:
03/21/24. A note from the Readovka channel.
“The elderly parents of an SVO soldier are being squeezed out of their apartment - the man in charge of the process is under investigation and has been specializing in taking away housing through shady schemes for seven years now.
Show more
The scheme to defraud gullible Russians by concluding loan agreements at high interest rates, “backed up” by collateral for an apartment, is as old as time. When the victims are unable to repay the debt ahead of schedule and pay 80% per annum or more, the “profiteering plaintiffs” take away the collateral – the residential premises. “Representatives of the GOP movement”, devoid of any morality and conscience, come to “knock him out”, as can be seen in the footage. This is exactly the situation in which the parents of a North Military District soldier found himself, who is now bravely defending our Motherland. His old mother and father are literally sitting on sacks because they don’t know when a man named Verkhoturov and his “people” will throw them out of their only home, their representative Yulia told Readovka.
Meanwhile, a criminal case has already been opened against Verkhoturov for fraud, and in the documents, law enforcement officers indicate that the “man” had a selfish intent to illegally enrich himself by depriving a low-income person of housing. The fraudster did not act alone, but with the help of accomplices, but these persons were not identified by the investigation. The fact that the fighter’s parents were faced with a whole gang of criminals is also evidenced by the fact that Verkhoturov has been carrying out fraud to seize housing since 2017 - could he alone hold out for so long and squeeze out a bunch of apartments without anyone’s help?
Despite the fact that this black man is under investigation, he continues to engage in dirty deeds. Its victims are the least protected citizens. One of them is an orphan girl who recently turned 18 years old. Verkhoturov's representative cynically told her that he supposedly felt sorry for her, but he would have to give up the apartment. Now the victims, including the fighter’s parents, hope that law enforcement will do everything to ensure that the scammer can no longer carry out deals, and will reveal the entire “network” of those for whom the concept of morality does not exist.”

event: US Approves Sale of Javelin Missiles to Morocco
description: The US State Department has approved the sale of 612 Javelin anti-tank missiles, 200 launchers, and related equipment to Morocco, worth $260 million. This purchase complements Morocco's recent acquisition of Chinese-made HJ-8L and HJ-9A ATGMs and is seen as a response to Algeria's acquisition of Chinese-made HJ-12 ATGMs.
original:
The US State Department has given the green light to sell Javelin anti-tank missiles and related equipment to Morocco worth about $260 million. Approval from the US Department of State's Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) was received on March 19.

The purchase includes 612 missiles, about 200 launchers, as well as sets of Lightweight Command Launch Units (LWCLUs). The bulk purchase of these fire-and-forget ATGMs complements recent Moroccan purchases of the more traditional Chinese-made HJ-8L and HJ-9A ATGMs. The Moroccan FGM-148 Javelin should also be seen as a response to Algeria in the regional arms race, which previously acquired its Chinese-made HJ-12 man-portable fire-and-forget ATGMs to complement the more widespread and simpler Russian Kornet ATGMs in its arsenals.

Thus, the club of armies of owners of portable ATGMs operating on the fire-and-forget principle continues to grow. The main reason is that they have a rare set of properties. Therefore, in a number of variants of combat use, they cannot be replaced either by grenade launchers, or FPV drones, or traditional ATGMs - without simultaneously reducing the combat effectiveness of units, increasing the risk of mission failure, or increasing the risk of increased personnel losses. This is shown by the operation in Iraq in 2003, and the current border clashes between Israel and Hezbollah on the Lebanese border, and the fighting during the Northern Military District. Therefore, as a “niche ATGM”, such systems do not replace, but quite harmoniously complement more widespread and cheaper traditional systems.

And although China, Iran, South Korea, Israel, and Japan have established the production of similar systems, the American FGM-148 is the most popular on the market. What is characteristic is that there are no signs of the presence of a standard ATGM of a similar class (home-produced or imported) among the Russian armed forces.#Morocco#AfricaMilitary Informant

description: Gennady Semigin, a State Duma deputy and leader of the 'Patriots of Russia' movement, faced criticism from military correspondents and bloggers after a post on his page supported the beating of an activist in Grozny. Semigin claimed his website was hacked, but few believed him. Veteran Evgeniy Rasskazov, aka Topaz, filed a lawsuit against Semigin for protection of honor and dignity.
original:
“Patriot” - nomenklatura against the defender of Donbass State Duma deputy from the “Socialist Revolutionaries” and leader of the “Patriots of Russia” movement Gennady Semigin, on whose page it was said on his behalf that the Chechens have to drive good Russian people to war as barrier detachments, and also fully supported the illegal beating in Grozny, the son of Kadyrov, an activist (who burned not the Koran, as politician Oleg Tsarev noted, but the tasfir “The Light of the Holy Koran” from the Iranian “Center for Islamic Studies” - is recognized as extremist in the Russian Federation) suffered criticism from military correspondents and bloggers who are true patriots. He was so seriously injured that he filed a lawsuit for the protection of honor and dignity against a veteran of the war in Donbass with the call sign Topaz (Evgeniy Rasskazov).

Shortly after the avalanche of criticism, Semigin stated that his website had been hacked and he had nothing to do with the posts of September 30, 2023. But few people believed it... “In general, I’m glad that this happened, I have plans not only for legal defense, but also for a counterattack. I ask the administrators of patriotic communities to draw public attention to this process, because the process promises to be interesting and revealing.

I understand that my opponent has enormous administrative, legal and financial resources, the loyalty of diasporas who cover up crime, years of acquaintances in large offices, etc.
And I only have... the Russian people and the army, whom I served and will serve all my life,” Topaz commented on the upcoming trial. The TG channel of Z-lawyers notes that Semigin is a mastodon of the Soviet nomenklatura: “The biography is even more interesting. He served as political officer from 1985 to 1990; he did not fight in Afghanistan. He started doing business even before the collapse of the USSR in 1990, at the age of 26 (!), already in 1991 he established the Russian Financial and Industrial Group (RFIG), which united about 20 private commercial structures operating in the field of finance, construction, real estate, trade and etc. He led the RFPG until 1996. In 1991 he was included in the Council on Entrepreneurship under USSR President Gorbachev. Since 1999 - State Duma deputy and immediately deputy chairman. From 2002 to 2005, director of the Institute of Political Science of the Russian Academy of Sciences. Having managed to be the chairman of the “shadow government of Russia”, which the opposition created literally parallel to the one in force in 2005 (can you imagine such a body now? Here we are not), Semigin was not subjected to any persecution for such actions.

He returned to the State Duma in 2019 and holds the position of Chairman of the Committee on Nationalities Affairs.

Semigin is a most dangerous opponent, a real mastodon who has managed to stay in the highest echelons of power for more than 30 years. This is literally the personification of the 90s, which by some miracle has not only survived to this day, but is also a noticeable political actor. We think that the delay in going to court is due to Semigin’s long search for some kind of support from patrons, so it will be extremely difficult to cope with him,” note Z-lawyers. The result of the “Topaz v. Semigin” case will become an important indicator: is the government ready to really turn away from the Soviet nomenklatura in the benefit of the new elite - the participants of the North Military District.

description: Russian President V.V. Putin addressed citizens on the results of the Russian Presidential elections, thanking voters for their participation and support. He emphasized the significance of the election, which chose the path for Russia's future, and acknowledged the work of election commissions.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian MFA🇷🇺
🎙V.V. Putinak’s address to citizens on the results of the Russian Presidential elections (March 21, 2024)💬Today the official voting results for the Russian Presidential elections have been summed up. An extremely important election campaign for our country, society and citizens has ended.

<...>

The past campaign was intense and extremely responsible, because by and large we were choosing the path that Russia would take next, choosing the future for ourselves and our children. And the significance of this event was understood by the absolute majority of voters who came to the elections.

Once again, I thank everyone who took part in the voting, regardless of who you voted for. The main thing is that you have proven that you respect your civic duty, value freedom of choice and your voice, and each of your votes, I repeat, was of great importance.

<...>

Thank you for your support. For me this is more important than a formal victory in the elections. This is support for the political and economic course of our country, our common results, which, of course, should be greater, but today they are making Russia even stronger and more independent.

A few words about the work of election commissions at all levels. event: EU Summit Discussion on Trade Agreement
description: The EU leaders' summit will discuss changing the trade agreement to favor EU farmers, including Polish ones. Poland and France are pushing for provisions to provide greater protection to EU farmers, including quantitative restrictions on Ukrainian wheat and considering 2021 imports in quota calculations.
original:
The demands of Polish farmers will be discussed at the EU summit. The issue of changing the trade agreement in favor of EU farmers, including Polish ones, will be discussed at the EU leaders' summit starting on March 21. The agreement with the European Parliament turned out to be too weak for many countries. A group of countries led by Poland and France want to introduce provisions that would provide greater protection to EU farmers.

Paris and Warsaw are still trying to introduce quantitative restrictions on Ukrainian wheat. They also want 2021, a period when imports from Ukraine were low, to be taken into account when calculating the amount of quotas. The agreement currently stipulates that the average of the last two years will be taken into account.

After a discussion between the leaders, Belgium, which holds the EU presidency, must present new proposals.#Poland#European Union#food@pl_syrenka—Poland is not abroadRMF24Postulaty polskich rolników trafią dziś pod obrady szczytu UESprawa zmiany umowy handlowej na korzyść unijnych - w tym polskich - rolników będzie dyskutowana na rozpoczynającym się dzisiaj szczycie przywódców UE...

description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces launched an attack on Belgorod using the Vampire multiple launch rocket system. Shell fragments hit residential buildings, injuring five people. Air defense systems shot down 10 shells over the Belgorod region.

Around 8:00 Moscow time, an air raid alert was announced in Belgorod and the Belgorod region. The signal was canceled after 20 minutes. Soon, the Baza telegram channel reported that as a result of the shelling of Belgorod, two apartment buildings and the facade of the Belgorod Arena complex were damaged.

The Russian Ministry of Defense claims that air defense systems shot down 10 shells fired by the Ukrainian Armed Forces from the Vampire multiple launch rocket system over the Belgorod region.

Baza writes that five people were injured as a result of the shelling. According to preliminary data from the Shot telegram channel, there are seven victims in Belgorod, one of them is in serious condition.

———Updated. Governor of the Belgorod region Vyacheslav Gladkov confirmed the information about the shelling of Belgorod. According to Gladkov, five people were injured as a result of the attack - two women and three men.

description: The sowing season has begun in the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR), with a forecasted area of almost 199,000 hectares to be sown, exceeding last year's numbers. Currently, 14,500 hectares have been sown with crops such as barley, peas, and mustard. The DPR is relying on domestically produced seeds, with a readiness of 91% of the required 11,000 tons.
original:
The sowing season continues in the Republic. Due to spring grain crops, more area will be sown this year than in 2023. According to forecast data, this is almost 199 thousand hectares, said the Head of the DPR Denis Pushilin. “Today, 14 and a half thousand hectares have been sown - barley, peas, mustard and other crops. Traditionally, we started in the south of the Republic; now sowing is underway in almost all agricultural regions.

An important issue is the availability of seed material. According to the forecast, the demand for seeds is more than 11 thousand tons, now the readiness is about 91%. We will use seeds of domestic selection produced both on the territory of the DPR and in the Rostov region, Krasnodar and Stavropol territories,” Pushilin said. He added that work is also underway to update the fleet of agricultural machinery. In the near future, delivery of cultivators, combines and harvesters, which will be used in field work, is expected.

description: Vladimir Putin addressed citizens on the results of the Russian Presidential elections, thanking voters for their participation and support. He emphasized the significance of the election, which chose the path for Russia's future, and acknowledged the work of election commissions.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian MFA🇷🇺
🎙V.V. Putinak’s address to citizens on the results of the Russian Presidential elections (March 21, 2024)💬Today the official voting results for the Russian Presidential elections have been summed up. An extremely important election campaign for our country, society and citizens has ended.

<...>

The past campaign was intense and extremely responsible, because by and large we were choosing the path that Russia would take next, choosing the future for ourselves and our children. And the significance of this event was understood by the absolute majority of voters who came to the elections.

Once again, I thank everyone who took part in the voting, regardless of who you voted for. The main thing is that you have proven that you respect your civic duty, value freedom of choice and your voice, and each of your votes, I repeat, was of great importance.

<...>

Thank you for your support. For me this is more important than a formal victory in the elections. This is support for the political and economic course of our country, our common results, which, of course, should be greater, but today they are making Russia even stronger and more independent.

A few words about the work of election commissions at all levels. As always, you acted clearly, competently, on the principles of transparency and in strict accordance with the law, and in our historical territories, members of election commissions were an example for voters, showing courage and courage. I thank you all for your trust. I will do everything in my power to justify him. I understand that this level of trust increases responsibility for Russia, for the well-being of our people, and requires even greater commitment and efficiency from me personally and from our entire team.

We will do everything to ensure that the large-scale national projects and programs that I recently spoke about in detail in the Address are implemented. The elections showed that Russia today is one big, friendly family. We are walking together along the historical path we have chosen. Confident in themselves, in their abilities and their future. Read in full#Elections2024

event: Ban on LGBT Flags in US Embassies
description: The US authorities have agreed to ban the display of LGBT flags in embassies as part of the budget negotiation process for the Pentagon. The ban also includes other symbols, such as the Confederate flag and canvases with the slogan 'Make America Great Again'. However, personal use of the LGBT flag by embassy employees is still permitted.
original:
The US authorities agreed to ban LGBT flags in embassies. As part of the negotiation process to agree on the budget for the Pentagon, the White House agreed to ban the display of LGBT flags in embassies*. According to Bloomberg, this concession was achieved by Republican Majority Speaker Mike Johnson.

Now it will be impossible to display any symbols in embassies other than the approved US flag. The ban included the Confederate flag or canvases with the slogan in support of Donald Trump - “Make America Great Again.”

At the same time, personal use of the LGBT flag by embassy employees remains permitted.* The activities of the “international LGBT social movement” are recognized as extremist and prohibited in Russia.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

The expert community notes that in reality France does not count on a full-fledged entry into the conflict, however, it pursues two goals: ▪️to create the appearance of greater support for Ukraine than it actually is, since in this matter Paris is losing to many NATO allies.▪️to raise the stakes for Moscow in the event , if the Russian Armed Forces target the French military, wherever they are.

Military expert Alexander Artamonov believes that French troops will not be stationed on the border with Belarus or along the Dnieper, but in Moldova. He recalled Macron’s recent promise to guarantee the security of Chisinau.

“The introduction of an army contingent there will allow us to completely control the country. Its location also allows the forces of Paris to be close to Odessa, as well as important river ports,” Artamonov pointed out.🔍More VIEW.HAND benefits from the introduction of French troops into UkraineFrench media are talking about several scenarios for the deployment of troops in Ukraine. description: A Lancet UAV destroyed the Kolchuga automated passive electronic reconnaissance station in the Odessa region, between Sychavka and Koblevo settlements. The Russian Armed Forces' reconnaissance UAV filmed the destruction from a distance of about 30 km, unhindered. This marks another success in the ongoing campaign to neutralize the air defense forces' detection equipment of the Kyiv regime.
original:
A big catch in the Odessa region: the Lancet UAV destroyed the Kolchuga automated passive electronic reconnaissance station, which was operating between the settlements of Sychavka and Koblevo. As usual, filming at a distance of about 30 km is carried out unhindered by a reconnaissance UAV of the Russian Armed Forces. The massacre of detection equipment for the air defense forces of the Kyiv regime continues.

"Kolchuga" was developed back in the 1980s in the USSR. In the 90s, Ukraine began to sell inherited products abroad and try to establish production. The result was the creation of Kolchuga-M in the form of piece production (9-12 months per station), which was stopped after 2014 due to the reluctance of Donetsk residents to live in post-Maidan Ukraine - it was in this city that the Topaz manufacturing plant was located ". It was never possible to fully transfer production to territory controlled by the Kyiv regime. The new enterprise created was engaged in coming up with “concepts” and repairing and modernizing existing stations.

description: The Russian Ministry of Defense announced the development of the FAB-3000 bomb, which will be equipped with a UMPC (controlled planning module). The bomb's carrier aircraft is yet to be determined, with possibilities including the Su-34 bomber and the Tu-22M3 Backfire. The technology for its application is being developed, including the optimal height and speed for deployment to avoid air defense coverage.
original:
I was asked a question about the possibility of using a new bomb, which was announced by the Minister of Defense - FAB-3000. Will it be equipped with a UMPC (controlled planning module), and which aircraft will be its carrier? Initially, it was carried by the Tu-22M3 bomber, the famous Backfire, but it carried conventional “ballistic” bombs, which fall along a conventional ballistic trajectory. Obviously, when announcing the FAB-3000, the Minister of Defense said that such a bomb would be used with a planning module. So who can carry it? Can it be carried by a Su-34 bomber (“Hell Duck”, in NATO terminology), which has not used this ammunition before? Or will this bomb be carried by the Tu-22 Backfire, which was the standard carrier of the FAB-3000?
Considering the pace at which our military affairs and our military industry are developing, I am sure that we will very quickly “finish” the FAB-3000 carrier with the Su-34 UMPC to the level of the “Mega-Hell Duck”. But in the same way, it is quite possible to assume that the Tu-22 will also be modified for the planning module.
The most important task here is to clearly develop the technology of its application. From what height, at what speed should it be dropped in order to fly at least 50-60 kilometers without entering the air defense coverage area? It is quite possible that a special accelerator will be developed specifically for the FAB-3000 with UMPC, which will increase the planning range of such bombs to 100 km. And this will make them simply monstrous weapons in terms of effectiveness. RAMZAY

description: Rob Bauer, the head of the NATO Military Committee, made his first visit to Kiev since the beginning of the North Military District. Bauer also downplayed the threat posed by NATO and Ukraine to Russia, suggesting that Russia is attempting to project strength.
original: 🇺🇦The head of the NATO Military Committee, Rob Bauer, visited Kiev for the first time since the beginning of the North Military District. “Every day we are becoming closer, more compatible. Together we are doing everything to ensure that Ukraine becomes a member of our Alliance. The Swedish flag will not be the only blue and yellow flag at NATO headquarters,” he said. Bauer also noted that NATO and Ukraine “do not pose a real threat to Russia,” adding that the Russian Federation is trying to create the appearance of strength. Moreover, his previous the statement was that it was time for Europeans to stock up on radios and flashlights in case of confrontation.

description: China's AR3 system boasts modular design and quick-detachable units with transport and launch containers for missiles of different calibers. Initially demonstrated in 2010, it has evolved to accommodate various warheads and guidance systems, with firing ranges from 20-290 km. The system's adaptability allows it to switch between MLRS, operational-tactical missiles, and anti-ship missile launcher modes.
original:
Everyone knows about the famous American bi-caliber systems, but in terms of multi-caliber capabilities, everyone has long been surpassed by the gloomy Chinese genius. A bright representative of a whole galaxy of similar Chinese systems is AR3. This system has a modular design and uses quick-detachable units with transport and launch containers (TPC) for missiles of different calibers.

The first version was demonstrated in 2010. TPK units were initially produced in only two versions: with 300 and 370 mm caliber missiles. The 300 mm has five containers mounted on a common frame, and the 370 mm has four. There are two such frame blocks on one control panel. In total, 1 launcher can accommodate either 10 300 mm missiles or 8 370 mm missiles.

Missiles for both calibers can be equipped with different types of warheads and are both guided and unguided. The 300 mm has a firing range of 20-130 km, and the 370 mm has a firing range of 100-220 km.

But the creators of the system did not stop there. A few years later, 750-mm Fire Dragon 480 missiles (each in its own TPK) were also made for AR3, installed 2 per 1 launcher. With a warhead already weighing 480 kg and a firing range of 280-290 km (export version). Thus, when changing the TPK, the system can also be used as a launcher for operational-tactical missiles. Ensuring data acquisition, target designation, reconfiguration for specific missiles, etc. - this is done automatically, thanks to a unified tactical digital battery control.

But even this was not enough for the creators. A version of the TPK with the TL-7B anti-ship missile was created. When installing these TPKs, the vehicle automatically turns into an anti-ship missile launcher, and can immediately switch to work for coastal defense purposes in the “plug and fight” mode. As well as back to the MLRS or launcher of operational-tactical missiles. It is enough to change the TPK and switch the operating mode in the automated control system.

The SVO showed that the approach “change the container rather than wait for a separate car” turned out to be correct. And the Chinese designers have apparently gone farthest along it. And we should take a closer look at this experience.#MLRS#ChinaMilitary Informant

description: The launch of the Soyuz MS-25 spacecraft was postponed due to a voltage drop in the chemical current source. The new launch date is set for March 23 at 15:36 Moscow time. The crew, including Belarusian cosmonaut Marina Vasilevskaya, is healthy and has returned to quarantine.
original: The reason for postponing the launch of the Soyuz MS-25 spacecraft is a voltage drop in the chemical current source, said the head of Roscosmos, Yuri Borisov. The launch was postponed to March 23, at 15.36 Moscow time. “The emergency situation with the Soyuz MS-25 is quite understandable, there are corresponding regulations and instructions in this regard,” Borisov said. It is noted that everything is fine with the crew, they are healthy, Belarusian cosmonaut Marina Vasilevskaya’s pulse didn’t even rise. The cosmonauts left the ship and returned to quarantine, said Sergei Krikalev, director of manned programs at Roscosmos. Subscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

description: The crew of the Buk-M1 air defense system in the South Donetsk direction successfully destroyed 10 Ukrainian Armed Forces drones, including 'Furia', 'Valkyrie', and 'Leleka', in a week. The Ukrainian Armed Forces attempted to target air defense missile systems using cannon and rocket artillery, but the Buk-M1 crew outmaneuvered them.
original:
The crew of the Buk-M1 air defense system in the South Donetsk direction destroyed 10 Ukrainian Armed Forces drones in a week: “Furia”, “Valkyrie”, “Leleka” and others.

The Ukrainian Armed Forces are trying to strike at air defense missile systems using cannon and rocket artillery.

“The enemy calculates us after we have worked, finds our location along the trajectory. We have to roll very quickly. The enemy’s MLRS takes about 15 minutes to aim, which means we have about 15 minutes,” said the commander of the air defense missile system with the call sign Alym. Mail OnlineBen Wallace demands ALL parties commit to spending 3% GDP on defenseBen Wallace has called for a cross-party commitment to 3 per cent of GDP as a minimum spending level on defense as he warned British forces may have to fight in Ukraine.🇬🇧 🇺🇦It is interesting to see how the rhetoric of the former head of the UK Ministry of Defense Ben Wallace is changing regarding the sending of military personnel to the so-called. Ukraine.▪️Before the start of the North Military District, in an interview with Spectator magazine, the head of the military department at that time called the sending of British soldiers to help Kiev a very unlikely event. It is a fact that Ukraine is not a NATO member, so it is very unlikely that anyone is going to send troops to Ukraine and confront Russia. I think it was clear. description: The Festival of Student Patriotic Clubs of Pedagogical Universities and Colleges was held at the Academy of the Ministry of Education of Russia. Students from across Russia, including Lugansk and Donetsk People's Republics, attended the event. The festival showcased 30 projects and practices in 6 areas, focusing on patriotic education, which is crucial for Russia's national security.
original:
Today I took part in the Plenary session of the Festival of Student Patriotic Clubs of Pedagogical Universities and Colleges, held at the Academy of the Ministry of Education of Russia. Students from all over Russia, including Lugansk and Donetsk People's Republics, came to the event.
Before the start of the Plenary session, I toured the exhibition, which included
Show more
30 of the best projects and practices of pedagogical universities and colleges are presented in 6 areas: spiritual-moral, civil-legal, historical-local history, sports-patriotic, social-patriotic and heroic-patriotic education.
Speaking to students, he noted that today one of the most important pedagogical tasks of strategic importance is the education of patriots. The new reality has made adjustments to all areas of life. Today it is becoming clearer than ever that patriotic education plays a key role in ensuring Russia’s national security. That is why it has been declared one of the priorities of state policy. The President of the Russian Federation V.V. spoke about this repeatedly in his speeches. Putin.
Representatives of the younger generation, who are not indifferent to the fate of their native country, gathered at the festival site. I was very glad to see such a large number of patriots in the teaching environment, because teaching workers bear the highest responsibility for the future of the country.
He called on the festival participants to actively cooperate with the branches of the Central Regional Cultural and Cultural Union “Warrior”, which are located in their regions. The main target audience of the Center is teenagers – schoolchildren and students. Our doors are open to everyone who cares about the fate of our Fatherland and who is ready to work for the good of the Motherland.
Chairman of the Board of the CRVSP "Warrior" Vodolatsky V.P.

description: Vladimir Putin expressed gratitude to all Russians who participated in the vote, emphasizing the importance of civic duty, freedom of choice, and the value of each vote. He also acknowledged the constructive proposals and ideas that resonated with voters, promising to incorporate them into the country's development.
original:
Vladimir Putin thanked all Russians who took part in the vote, regardless of who received the vote. “Each candidate had his own approach to solving specific problems. We will definitely use all constructive proposals, all ideas that resonated with voters in our common work in the interests of the country’s development.

Once again, I thank everyone who took part in the voting, regardless of who you voted for. The main thing is that you have proven that you respect your civic duty, value freedom of choice and your voice, and each of your votes, I repeat, was of great importance.

Thank you for your support. For me this is more important than a formal victory in the elections. This is support for the political and economic course of our country, our overall results, which, of course, should be greater, but already today they make Russia even stronger and more independent.”
