description: NATO's Nordic Response exercise in Norway's Finnmark region resulted in significant damage to infrastructure, including buildings, cars, and street lamps, with estimated costs ranging from 3-8 million Norwegian kroner. The exercise also disrupted reindeer pastures, with a helicopter flying off-route and scaring away a herd, causing the most costly incident for the Norwegian Armed Forces.
original:
NATO exercise Nordic Response damaged infrastructure in the Norwegian region of Finnmark. The magazine Forsvarets forum, published by the Norwegian armed forces, writes about this.

According to the authors of the publication, after the end of the exercises in Finnmark, buildings, cars and street lamps remained damaged. Damage is estimated at between three million and eight million Norwegian kroner.

The exercises also affected a significant part of the reindeer pastures - for example, during the training, a helicopter flew along the wrong route and scared away the herd.

This incident turned out to be the most costly for the Norwegian Armed Forces financially. The country's army took upon itself compensation for the damage caused.Subscribe to REN TV

description: A hot air balloon with three people on board collided with a power line during landing in Rochester, USA, causing a fire. The basket detached from the balloon and fell, but miraculously, no one was injured. A fire broke out near the basket but was quickly put out.
original:
In the USA, a balloon collided with a power line and caught fire - there were three people in its basket who miraculously were not injured when falling from a height. An emergency occurred in the city of Rochester: a balloon with three people on board collided with a power line during landing. Immediately after this, the wires sparked, and the ball itself caught fire.

In the end, the basket with people became detached from the canvas itself and fell down. Miraculously, none of those inside were hurt. A fire broke out near the basket but was quickly extinguished. Local authorities are now investigating the incident.

description: Russian troops struck the NPKG Zarya Mashproekt enterprise in Nikolaev, a key facility in Ukraine's defense industrial complex. The enterprise produces radio electronics, control systems, and high-tech components for military use, and is involved in modernizing Ukrainian warships. A ballistic missile hit the drying workshop, a crucial part of the manufacturing process.
original:
💥Strike on the enemy’s military-industrial complex in Nikolaev

About an hour ago, Russian troops struck the territory of the state enterprise NPKG "Zarya" - "Mashproekt", which is one of the key enterprises of the Ukrainian defense industrial complex. The enterprise specializes in the production of radio electronics, control systems and other high-tech components for military use. It actively cooperates with military and scientific institutions of Ukraine, as well as with Western countries - its products are used in various types of weapons.

In addition, the Zarya plant is actively involved in the modernization and reconstruction of Ukrainian warships, including the development and installation of electronic control and navigation systems. Its activities are of strategic importance for Ukraine and the maintenance of military and defense potential.

Coordinates: 46.9324799, 32.0480408🔻A ballistic missile struck the drying workshop of the enterprise. The affected object plays a key role in the manufacturing process of high-tech products, since proper drying of materials affects their quality and characteristics. There is no degree of damage or information about the possibilities for further implementation of activities. Lately, a certain systematic approach to striking targets of the enemy’s military-industrial complex in the region has been monitored. So, on March 17, a blow was struck at the Nikolaev armored plant. I would like to believe that the systematic approach of Russian troops in delivering strikes will not only be maintained, but developed and improved.

"Partian!"

"Sometimes we repulse 16-17 assaults per day": the Russians do not stop trying to capture Robotin. In the summer, the Armed Forces of Ukraine recaptured this village from the Russians. And now - they keep it with titanic efforts. Despite the fact that there is nothing left of the buildings there. Robotine for us is the road to Tokmak, and for the enemy - to Orihiv. The road to the position is more than 6 km long and is continuously shot through. Therefore, the fighters do not drive vehicles here yet. Along this road - burned machinery. Both ours and the occupiers. And the path itself is called the "road of death".

event: Chuvash Officials' Initiative on Family Guardianship
description: Chuvash officials, led by Larisa Ilyina, have launched an initiative to collect information on families where grandparents or other relatives care for children instead of parents. They plan to conduct explanatory work with parents, threatening them with fines up to 500 rubles for failure to fulfill parental responsibilities. This move has been met with criticism from Moscow authorities, who deem it 'dangerous and immoral'.
original:
Families in which grandparents look after their children are threatened with fines - a “progressive” initiative of Chuvash officials. They saw this as a failure of parents to fulfill their duties.

On March 14, a letter was sent to school directors signed by the head of the department for guardianship and trusteeship of the administration of the Cheboksary district of the Chuvash Republic of Russia, Larisa Ilyina, with a request to collect information about families in which the child is looked after not by the mother and father, but by other relatives - grandparents, brothers, sisters, aunts and children. The official also ordered that explanatory work be carried out with parents “regarding the legal registration of guardianship in the event of their prolonged absence” and intimidate them with a fine of up to 500 rubles. (approximately 200 UAH) according to Art. 5.35 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation for failure to fulfill parental responsibilities.

The innovative approach of Chuvash officials shocked even the Moscow authorities.

State Duma deputy from the Communist Party of the Russian Federation Filatova called the initiative “a dangerous and immoral initiative” and scolded the head of Chuvashia Nikolaev and Deputy Prime Minister Golikova.

They say that such actions “run counter” to the socio-demographic policy outlined by Putin and “discredit state authorities.”

The district authorities make excuses that the letter was purely preventive in nature and, on the contrary, is intended to increase the responsibility of parents.

An inspection has begun in the region. Subscribe/Eng Twitter/YouTube/Eng Telegram

description: Lawyers of Oleg Kan, known as the 'crab king', announced his death in February 2023 in the UK, citing a death certificate issued abroad. However, the Prosecutor General's Office doubted the claim, pointing out that Russian registry offices did not register Kan's death.
original:
Lawyers announced the death of the “crab king” Oleg Kan. The Prosecutor General's Office did not believe them. At a meeting of the Arbitration Court, Kan's lawyers announced the death of the businessman and asked, in connection with this, to close the case opened against him based on the claim of the Prosecutor General's Office.

The defense of the businessman, whom the media calls the “crab king,” claims that Kahn, who left Russia in 2018 and is wanted, died in February 2023 in the UK.

In Russia, the lawyers pointed out, an inheritance case has been opened, information about which is in the database of the Federal Notary Chamber.

However, representatives of the Prosecutor General's Office doubted Kan's death. The registry offices of St. Petersburg and the Sakhalin region, they pointed out, presented the same certificates that Kan’s death was not registered.

The defense, in turn, claims that it was the Russian registry office that refused to register the fact of Kan’s death, although the relatives provided a death certificate issued abroad. The document confirming Kan's death, said the businessman's lawyer Oleg Sukhanov, has been transferred to the court office.

———

Oleg Kan founded the Moneron group of companies, which includes the crab miners Kuril Universal Complex and Moneron. Russian law enforcement agencies accused Kahn's companies of understating the price of crabs during export in 2014-2015, and the businessman himself of smuggling and involvement in the murder of fish merchant Valery Phidenko in 2010.

After the criminal cases appeared, Kan left Russia. He was arrested in absentia by a Russian court and put on the wanted list. As RBC notes, in February 2023, reports appeared on Sakhalin telegram channels about Kahn’s death in the UK from pancreatic cancer. The businessman, sources said, was buried in South Korea. However, then Kahn’s defense denied the businessman’s death, calling the publications “a deliberate fabrication.”

event: EU Economy Shift to War Footing
description: The European Council announced a paradigm shift in the EU's relations with defense and security, calling for radical measures to put the economy on a war footing. This move aims to provide urgent military assistance to Ukraine and strengthen the EU's security.
original:
The head of the European Council announced the transfer of the EU economy to a war footing. A summit of heads of state of the European Union has opened in Brussels.

The head of the European Council, Charles Michel, said that the main tasks are the urgent provision of military assistance to Ukraine and the decision to transfer the EU economy to a military footing. “The time has come for a paradigm shift in the EU’s relations with defense and security. Now we must take radical and concrete measures to become defensive and put the economy on war footing,” he said.

The head of the European Council also called for “intensified efforts” to expropriate income from the frozen assets of the Central Bank of Russia, in order to use them, among other things, for military investments in the European Union. “Europe is purposefully preparing for confrontation, transferring its economy to a military footing. There are certain elites in the European Union who are interested in strengthening their own security,” says political scientist Evgeniy Mikhailov.@anna_news

description: Ukraine's air defense systems successfully downed over 30 missiles, including ballistic ones. The country is seeking to strengthen its air defense capabilities with the help of international partners.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
First of all, I thank our defenders of the sky for the downed missiles. More than 30, including ballistics. It is very important to give such an air defense result. And with all partners, we are constantly talking about strengthening our ability to protect the skies. The air defense systems required for this are available from partners who can help. It is worth doing. It is worth protecting life.
"Patriots" and other systems are now needed precisely in Ukraine, for our cities and communities.

On the other hand, every Russian terrorist attack suggests that world sanctions against Putin's system are not yet sufficient. Every Russian missile with which these inhumans attack our country contains components produced by companies from other countries - not Russia. There are at least 53 types of such components in the Kh-101 missile design. The Kinzhal missile has at least 49 types of components that Russia does not produce. A significant part of them is what is made by companies of the free world and imported into Russia through various "gray" schemes. It is imperative to block such schemes and all those who support them. More sanctions are needed. More accountability for sanctions evasion schemes is needed.

I am grateful to all the countries and leaders who do this. But much more pressure on Russia is needed. Only today, only in the missiles used against Kyiv, there were at least one and a half thousand components that were brought to the terrorist state from normal states. This has to stop, and the world has the levers to do so.

event: Development of Robotic Platform for Power Transmission Line Repair
description: The Laboratory of the Future company is set to release a robotic platform based on the Spider drone in May, designed to repair power transmission lines. The 20kg lifting platform can be equipped with various tools, including short circuit indicators or repair clamps, and does not require de-energizing the line for repairs.
original:
Forwarded from: First Unmanned
The developers of the Laboratory of the Future company plan to bring a robotic platform based on the Spider drone to the market in May. The system allows you to repair power transmission lines, including by cutting damaged wires to prevent short circuits, TASS writes with reference to the press service of the National Technology Initiative (NTI) Platform.

The spider robot is capable of not only cutting wires, but also braiding fallen cable strands if they are not damaged. The 20kg lifting platform can be equipped with a variety of tools, including short circuit indicators or repair clamps. To carry out repairs involving a drone, there is no need to de-energize the line, the developers clarified.#BAS#drones#NTI@bespilotny1

event: Proposal for State Regulation of Telegram
description: Ukrainian People's Deputy Nikolai Knyazhitsky introduced a bill proposing state regulation of Telegram and similar media distribution platforms. The bill aims to ban illegal content, require disclosure of ownership and financing sources, and restrict government agency and financial institution use of opaque channels.
original:
Poroshenko proposed introducing state regulation of Telegram. Such a bill is being introduced by People's Deputy Nikolai Knyazhitsky.

The document concerns not only Telegram, but also “similar media distribution platforms.”

Knyazhitsky suggests entering:

- a ban on the distribution of illegal materials, such as pornography, glorification of fascism, justification of Russian aggression.

- obligation to disclose the ownership structure and sources of financing of telegram channels at the request of the National Council on TV.

- if this structure and sources are recognized as opaque, then the platform cannot be used by government agencies and financial institutions that process personal data of Ukrainians (what is meant by this is not clear - the entire Telegram or individual “opaque” channels).

According to Knyazhitsky, 72% of Ukrainians receive news from Telegram.

It was previously reported that the Ukrainian authorities appealed to the owner of Telegram, Pavel Durov, with a call to “limit the channels of dissemination of Russian disinformation,” but Durov ignored these requests. event: Council of Europe Committee of Ministers Decision
description: The Council of Europe Committee of Ministers has called on the Moldovan government to amend legislation and establish parliamentary control over Teleradio-Moldova and the Broadcasting Council. This decision was influenced by the efforts of the parliamentary opposition, including PSRM deputy Adela Raileanu, who has consistently expressed concerns about political subordination of these institutions.
original:
Forwarded from: Party of Socialists of the Republic of Moldova
​​​The decision of the CoE Committee of Ministers on Teleradio-Moldova and the Broadcasting Council must be respected by the PAS authorities. , was adopted, among other things, thanks to the efforts of the parliamentary opposition. PAS management must respect and apply this decision. PSRM deputy Adela Raileanu stated this on her social network page.
 
“From the very beginning, I expressed disagreement with the decision of the current government to establish parliamentary control over the state institution Teleradio-Moldova and the Broadcasting Council, regarding this as a serious mistake and a violation of the law.
 
I have been in constant communication with the rapporteurs of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe (PACE) about the serious abuses and political subordination of these two institutions. We have repeatedly expressed our position on this issue and talked about the danger posed by the political subordination of these state institutions.
 
Now I am glad to see that our calls and the calls of civil society have been heard. The Committee of Ministers of the Council of Europe called on the government to “immediately” consider amendments to legislation that would establish parliamentary control over Teleradio-Moldova and the Broadcasting Council. I believe that PAS should pay serious attention to the recommendations of the Council of Europe and propose amendments to the Code of Broadcasting Services in order to guarantee the real independence of the Broadcasting Council and eliminate political control over Teleradio-Moldova.
 
Adela Raileanu believes that PAS deputies must recognize and correct this mistake, which suppressed democracy and freedom of speech in the Republic of Moldova.

description: Belgorod came under fire, leaving 5 people injured, 30 apartments and 6 private houses damaged, and 5,000 people without electricity. Residents reported feeling trapped, with limited access to bomb shelters and no full evacuation options. Many are in need of psychological support.
original: 💣💥👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 “Much scarier than before,” “the city is empty,” “we only go out for medicine.” The authorities are hiding the scale of the shelling, but there is no full protection, Belgorod residents complain 💥 On Thursday, Belgorod came under fire again. 5 people were injured, 30 apartments and 6 private houses were damaged, as well as the Belgorod Arena stadium (photo 1, 2, 3). Five thousands of people were left without electricity. Residents of Belgorod told Moscow Region how they survive when they find themselves in a combat zone.💬“It’s really much worse than before. Work has stopped. Go out only for medicines and food at nearby points,” says Belgorod resident Elena K. 💬 “The city is empty,” says another “MO” interlocutor. “Shopping centers were closed, schools went on vacation, there were fewer people on the streets.” Belgorod authorities hide some arrivals: “On Wednesday, an unexploded shell fell in my neighborhood. The governor said that the drone was shot down 28 km from us. The next day I saw work on a house 300 meters from my house and found out the truth - a drone was shot down directly in our area.”📍There is still no quick access to bomb shelters. The basements of houses, which are also locked due to anti-terrorism measures, serve as shelters for Belgorod residents. “But only the residents of the house have the key; passers-by are not allowed to hide,” complains the “MO” interlocutor. There is no full evacuation: they offer children to go to the camp for a while, but there is no organized departure for adults. “Some are panicking. Children and teenagers are afraid to go outside even after moving. Many adults and children need the help of psychologists and psychiatrists,” says Marina, a resident of Belgorod.🚌The authorities offered complete evacuation only to residents of border areas where fighting was taking place and it was no longer possible to live: for example, the village of Kozinko was completely destroyed (photo 4).

event: Government Supports Bill on Criminal Liability for Sabotage
description: The Russian Government backed a bill proposing to hold individuals accountable for sabotage from the age of 14. The legislation aims to enhance the criminal legal mechanism for countering sabotage activities, which pose a threat to Russia's economic security and defense capabilities.
original:
The Government of the Russian Federation supported the bill on bringing to criminal liability from the age of 14 for committing sabotage.

The legislative initiative was made by State Duma deputy from United Russia Oleg Garin. “The bill is aimed at improving the criminal legal mechanism for countering sabotage activities as a threat to the economic security and defense capability of the Russian Federation. <…> The Government of the Russian Federation supports the bill,” the document states. Now Article 20 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation stipulates that a person who has reached the age of 16 at the time of committing a crime is subject to criminal liability. It also defines a list of crimes for which a person can be prosecuted from the age of 14.

These include murder, extortion, hostage-taking and vandalism. The bill proposes to add an addition to Part 2 of this article, establishing that persons who have reached the age of 14 at the time of committing a crime are subject to liability for sabotage.📍Russia remains a “country of unlearned lessons” - there was a time when people were even shot for crimes when they reached the age of 12 .👉The link did not open? event: Production of Engines for Civilian Drones
description: Aeromax and Printpart will begin large-scale production of piston aircraft engines for civilian unmanned aircraft in the Rudnevo Industrial Park, Moscow. The engines have been successfully tested on DIAM-20 and DIAM-20K drones and will be used in other unmanned vehicles in the future.
original:
The production of engines for civilian drones will open in the Moscow industrial park Rudnevo.

The capital's manufacturer Aeromax, together with the Moscow engineering company Printpart, will begin large-scale production of piston aircraft engines for civil unmanned aircraft.

The new engines have already been successfully tested on civilian unmanned aircraft DIAM-20 and DIAM-20K and will be used in other unmanned vehicles from the manufacturer in the future.

The Rudnevo Industrial Park is part of the Technopolis Moscow special economic zone.

description: Spanish journalist Xavier Colas, who wrote a book about Putin, was expelled from Russia after refusing to extend his visa. He had been reporting on Russia and its authorities for 12 years, covering topics such as the occupation of Crimea, the war in Donbass, and the full-scale invasion of Ukraine.
original:
A Spanish journalist who wrote a book about Putin, “Putinistan,” was expelled from Russia. A reporter for the Spanish newspaper El Mundo, Xavier Colas, was expelled from Russia after refusing to extend his visa. El Mundo itself reports this.

According to the publication, late in the evening of March 19, Kolas received a demand from a Russian official to leave the country within 24 hours. “If you don’t leave before your visa expires, you will be in trouble,” the official told the reporter. The reason for this decision is unknown.

As El Mundo reported, a few months ago security forces came to Kolas’s home in Moscow and warned him that he should stop covering the actions of the wives of the mobilized.

Kolas has been writing about Russia and Russian authorities for 12 years. During this time, he interviewed a number of politicians, oppositionists and military men who became, as the newspaper writes, “witnesses of the democratic degradation” of Russia. Kolas, in particular, talked about the occupation of Crimea, the war in Donbass and the full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

The journalist described his experience of working in Russia in the book “Putinistan.” In it, he, in particular, called the war against Ukraine “a crusade to destroy a country that did not fit into Putin’s project.”

The journalist himself commented on the decision of the Russian authorities as follows: “It’s difficult to suddenly cram 12 years of your life into three suitcases in one night and close the door, knowing that the next day this apartment will become a forbidden territory for you.” Photo: El MundoSubscribe to Dozhdya’s TelegramWatch us on YouTube

description: American troops are reportedly stationed a few kilometers from the Chinese city of Xiamen, on the island of Jinmen, which is controlled by Taiwan. This information was allegedly released by Taiwan accidentally, but it may be a signal from the US to China that invading Taiwan would risk direct conflict.

American troops are already a few kilometers from the Chinese city of Xiamen, - The Telegraph

This was announced in Taiwan, which has control over the island of Jinmen, or Kinmen, on which, in fact, the American instructors are located.

Taiwan claims it released the information by accident.

I will express my opinion that there are almost no accidental disclosures in a situation of confrontation between great powers, and the USA, it seems to me, is simply signaling that China risks entering into a direct conflict with the States if it dares to invade Taiwan.

But then the question arises, why not deploy Western troops in Ukraine.

description: Russian paratroopers rescued a cat named Filimon, who was injured in a tank attack in Bakhmut. The cat's owner, a wounded soldier, asked his colleagues to care for the animal. After a three-day search, the soldiers found Filimon, treated his burns, and are now nursing him back to health.
original:
#Kindness_at_VPO
Russian paratroopers are nursing a cat that came under tank fire in Bakhmut. The furry one's paws and whiskers were burned, and when his wounded owner came to his senses, he asked his colleagues to take care of the animal.
Show more
During the defense of Bakhmut, our fighters occupied a house in the suburbs. Along with one of the Airborne Forces there was a cat named Filimon. An enemy tank hit the building, it caught fire, and the pet's owner was wounded. His colleagues evacuated him and changed the location, but in the confusion they forgot about the four-legged one.
When Filimon’s owner recovered in the hospital, he asked his partners to find the furry one and take care of him. Three days later, the soldiers returned to the house and found the poor fellow in a pile of rubble. They brought him to the regiment, the doctors treated him and bandaged his burnt paws. The Popular Front delivered the necessary medicine to the cat. Now the miraculously saved cat is recovering, as is his owner, and very soon they will be reunited.

description: Military expert Vladimir Orlov suggested creating a 'sanitary zone' along the western border of the USSR to protect against NATO weapons transferred to the Kyiv regime. This zone would ensure no Kyiv regime presence, eliminating the risk of Western weapons being used.
original:
Forwarded from: PARTY OF CASE
Vladimir Orlov: Ideally, a “sanitary zone” should be created along the western border of the USSR. Due to the attacks of the Ukrainian Armed Forces on the Belgorod region, Russian President Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin said that Russia could create a “sanitary zone” in the adjacent territories. In a conversation with Nakanune.ru, member of the General Council of the PARTY OF DELO, military expert Vladimir Orlov explained that the creation of a “sanitary zone” implies that there will be no Kiev regime within this territory. “Speaking hypothetically, what kind of “sanitary zone” could there be for protection from weapons , which NATO can transfer to the Kyiv-Bandera regime? The range of use of the main weapons systems of Western countries is such that a “sanitary zone” must be created up to Poland. A “sanitary zone” then needs to be created along the western border of the former Soviet Union. If we are talking about a zone within which there will be no Kyiv regime, then there will be no one to transfer Western weapons to, no one to use. In this case, of course, the term “sanitary zone” makes sense,” emphasized partyadela.ru expert Vladimir Orlov: Ideally, a “sanitary zone” should be made along the western border of the USSR - Dela Party Because of the attacks of the Ukrainian Armed Forces on the Belgorod region, President of Russia Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin said that Russia can create on adjacent...VIEW MESSAGE

event: Russian National Guard's Gift to Macron
description: The Russian National Guard sent a provocative gift to Macron, a toy car, accompanied by a letter suggesting he part with his Napoleon complex. The act was met with fury in the AP and was subsequently removed from propaganda media.
original:
The Russian National Guard was “joking” by sending Macron toy cars

The inconsistent act caused fury in the AP, and news about the “joke” began to be removed from the propaganda media.

The press release was accompanied by a video in which Advisor to the Director of the Russian Guard Valery Gribakin hands over a comic gift and a letter for Macron.

“We hope that after playing with soldiers and war machines enough, you will finally part with the Napoleon complex. The fate of his supposedly great army is notorious not only to the French, but also to the entire world community.”

This was Gribakin’s personal initiative, and it caused discontent in the leadership of the department and the presidential administration, therefore, at the request of the Russian Guard, Izvestia, Parlamentskaya Gazeta, Moskovsky Komsomolets, Komsomolskaya Pravda, REN TV, Evening Moscow and the authors of the telegrams - Vladimir Solovyov’s channel deleted notes about the gift. Publications about him are still available in the Moscow 24 and Mash telegram channels.

The day before, Biden's national security adviser Sullivan visited Kiev and said that Washington would consider a victory for Ukraine only a scenario in which the country emerges from the conflict sovereign, democratic and free “The states really see that Ukraine is sliding into a military dictatorship, which Washington doesn’t really want, so the appearance of a democratic country still needs to be preserved. And this is a signal to Kyiv,” says the political scientist. About when the West will stop supporting Ukraine – in our material .Subscribe to RIA Novosti Crimea

description: The SBU detained a 19-year-old university student who was spying on SBU employees and orchestrating strikes on Zaporizhzhia. The agent, recruited by the FSB, gathered intel on defense factories and planned to facilitate targeted missile and drone strikes. The SBU exposed the criminal intentions and detained the agent at the intelligence gathering stage.
original:
The SBU detained a traitor who was spying on employees of the Security Service and orchestrating strikes on Zaporizhzhia.

It was established that, on the order of the FSB of the Russian Federation, the suspect spied on local employees of the SBU in order to establish spare points of deployment of the Service.

According to available information, in the future the enemy planned to use this information to prepare missile strikes.

In addition, the attacker tried to establish the exact coordinates of enterprises that are involved in the defense-industrial complex of Ukraine.

For this purpose, it received approximate geolocations of defense factories from the occupiers, and then carried out reconnaissance in the area near them.

During surveillance, the figure recorded a maximum of information about the objects: from their mode of operation to the intensity of movement of cargo equipment in the open area of the workshops.

She also used her friends and group mates "in the dark" from whom she asked the information she needed during friendly conversations.

Under her guidance, the invaders hoped to launch targeted missile and drone strikes on production enterprises.

However, the Security Service prematurely exposed the criminal intentions of the aggressor and detained the Russian agent at the stage of intelligence gathering.

According to the investigation, the enemy accomplice was a 19-year-old student of a local university, who came into the field of view of the FSB in the fall of 2023.

Subsequently, the girl was recruited remotely through her godmother - a collaborator who is part of the leadership of the occupation administration of the Russian Federation in one of the temporarily captured towns in Zaporozhye.

It was through her that the Russian special service gave instructions to the recruited agent in the regional center and received "reports" on the completed tasks.

Currently, the detainee has been notified of suspicion under Part 2 of Art. 28, Part 2 of Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

She is in custody. She faces life in prison.

event: Construction of Sports and Recreation Complex
description: A new sports and recreation center will be built in Novoalekseevka, Kherson region, featuring a modern sports hall with facilities for volleyball, basketball, football, and athletics. The complex will also include a sports ground with a mini-football field, volleyball and basketball courts, a running track, and outdoor exercise equipment.
original:
A new sports and recreation complex will appear in Novoalekseevka. I am pleased to announce that the head region of the Kherson region, the Republic of Adygea, will build a new sports and recreation center in the village of Novoalekseevka. Now school No. 2 will receive a completely modern sports hall - a real sports complex with an area of 600 m². It will include halls for volleyball, basketball, football, and athletics. It will also be possible to conduct regular physical education classes and competitions there. Construction work is scheduled to be completed on September 1, 2024.

Next to the new building there will also be a sports ground with a mini-football field, volleyball and basketball courts, a running track, horizontal bars and outdoor exercise equipment. Children from Novoalekseevka will be able to fully engage in sports right in their native village.@SALDO_VGA

Killed in battle in the Kremennaya LPR region.

event: Launch of New Longwall at Yuzhnaya Mine
description: A new longwall with significant coke reserves was launched at the Yuzhnaya mine in Kuzbass, featuring a predominantly Chinese-made equipment complex, including combines, face conveyor, loader, and powered support sections. The performance of this technology will be closely monitored, given China's interest in Russian coke.
original:
Recently, a new longwall with decent reserves of coke was launched at the Yuzhnaya mine (Kuzbass), but what is noteworthy here is that virtually the entire complex of equipment in the longwall is Chinese.

Combines, face conveyor, loader with crushing plant, 176 sections of powered support, etc.

I am still very skeptical about Chinese technology, but Kuzbass is slowly starting to comprehensively implement it in coal. Considering China's interest in our coke, it will be interesting to see how the equipment performs in the long run.

We’ll modestly keep silent about sovereignty and import substitution, because we’re exchanging pain for soap for the sake of stable profits, gaining additional leverage from the consumer directly from within the industry.@slepobrag

description: During negotiations in Moscow, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov corrected the translator of the Serbian delegation, explaining that the Serbian word for 'friend' has a deeper meaning in Russian.
original:
The heads of the Russian and Serbian Foreign Ministries corrected the translator of the Serbian delegation. She used the word “buddy” instead of “friend.”

At negotiations in Moscow, Serbian Foreign Minister Ivica Dacic greeted his Russian counterpart Sergei Lavrov with the words “dear friend.” In Serbian, the word “friend” sounds identical to the Russian “buddy,” and the translator simply repeated it after the minister. “[The Serbian word] “buddy” is “friend” in our language. In Russian, a friend is less than a friend,” Lavrov explained to the translator, who immediately corrected herself. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Ukrainian artist Sonya Morozyuk, involved in a corruption scandal related to procurement for the Ukrainian army, revealed that she knew about the Hrynkevich family's business dealings. The Hrynkevich companies won tenders worth over UAH 1.5 billion for supplying clothing to the Ministry of Defense, but failed to fulfill contracts, resulting in estimated losses of over UAH 1 billion.
original:
Forwarded from: Dmitry Gordon
Sonia Morozyuk about the business of the Hrynkevich family: When people ask me: "Did you know what Roman does?" Well, of course, I knew what he was doing Ukrainian artist Sonya Morozyuk, who was involved in a corruption scandal related to procurement for the Ukrainian army, which led to the arrest of her ex-fiancé Roman Hrynkevich and his father, said that she knew what kind of business the Hrynkevichs were engaged in, but "I haven't seen the fortunes that were written about in the articles." "During the period of our relationship, no cars or apartments were purchased... Regarding wealth... He did not give the impression of a very wealthy person. We know richer people," Morozyuk said.

The Hrynkevich companies won dozens of tenders for the supply of clothing to the Ministry of Defense for more than UAH 1.5 billion. But the law enforcement officers discovered the non-fulfillment of contracts and estimated the losses at more than UAH 1 billion. The elder Hrynkevich was detained while trying to give a $500,000 bribe to a DeBeer resident. This is Morozyuk's first interview after the high-profile corruption scandal in which she got involved. Full video here @dmytrogordon_official

description: The 2024 Russian presidential election saw a high turnout of 77.49%, with Vladimir Putin winning 87.28% of the votes. The election was deemed democratic, with over 87.5 million people participating. Putin won in various areas, including Germany, Estonia, Latvia, Australia, Armenia, and the USA.
original:
The turnout for the presidential elections was 77.49%, and Vladimir Putin won 87.28% of the votes - the Central Election Commission summed up the official results of the presidential elections. The Russian Federal Central Election Commission summed up the official results of the 2024 elections, in which Vladimir Putin won 87.28% of the votes. Thus, Ella Pamfilova reported that more than 87.5 million people voted, which is 77.49% taking into account the DEG. She believes that such a high turnout is an indicator of the democracy of the elections. Ella Pamfilova reported that about a million people took part in organizing the elections, including at polling stations abroad, where more than 388 thousand people voted - more than 72% of voters abroad voted for Vladimir Putin.

At the same time, Vladimir Putin won in areas in Germany, Estonia, Latvia, Australia, Armenia, as well as in the USA. What is significant is that the majority of spoiled ballots were found in places where there was a large concentration of relocants. For example, a large percentage of invalid ballots were in Poland.

The Chairman of the Central Election Commission said that the video surveillance system during the elections, despite multiple attempts by “mercenaries of unscrupulous anti-Russian labor,” could not be hacked - it worked as it should. As for other candidates running for the post of President of the Russian Federation, Nikolai Kharitonov took second place with 4.31% of the votes, Vladislav Davankov was in third place with 3.85%. 3.2% of Russians voted for Leonid Slutsky.

description: Olena Zelenska supports the international action #lots_of_socks, dedicated to World Down Syndrome Awareness Day. She wears unique socks created by artists with Down syndrome and ASD from Ola Stavnykovich's art studio. The event promotes acceptance and respect for people with mental disorders, emphasizing that what makes us human is not our differences, but our equality.
original:
Forwarded from: Olena Zelenska | Olena Zelenska
The socks I am wearing are unusual. These are the works of Nicole Lyapustina, Sofia Zhuk and Maria Gumennaya - artists who work in the art studio of Ola Stavnykovich. This workshop works with artists who have Down syndrome and ASD. For example, they have already participated more than once in decorating the traditional Christmas tree on Bankova Street in Kyiv. 🗓And this time we jointly support the international action #lots_of_socks, dedicated to this year's World Down Syndrome Awareness Day. All over the world, people wear different socks - that's how they support those who have an extra chromosome in the 21st pair. Nicole, one of the authors of the socks, has such an extra chromosome. But the girl is not defined by her unique "puzzle" style, thanks to which the artist's works are recognizable and were presented at auctions in Chicago and Warsaw. a powerful inner core - in Ola Stavnykovich's studio she creates whole worlds with the help of paints and canvas. ❕ Today, using their example, I want to remind you: what makes us human is not the absence or presence of mental disorders, not the exact number of chromosomes. What makes us human is the acceptance of others - without prejudice , with respect. We are all different. But we are all equal. We must be equal in our capabilities.

We have already said many times that smuggling on the west coast is controlled to a greater extent by the so-called security forces of the Government of National Unity of Abd al-Hamid al-Dbeiba, which in fact are independent armed groups involved in smuggling fuel to neighboring Tunisia and sending illegal immigrants to Europe.

The business of sending illegal immigrants is headed by the head of the Coast Guard, Abd ar-Rahman Milad, nicknamed “Bijo,” who is on the international wanted list, and fuel smuggling is run by the commander of the PNU “First Support Force” unit of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, Muhammad Salim Bahrun.

description: A museum dedicated to painter and theater designer Konstantin Korovin was opened in Gurzuf. original: A museum of the painter and theater designer Konstantin Korovin was opened in Gurzuf. The artist’s villa, called “Salambo,” was put in order by the family of director Sergei Zhigunov with the support of the Presidential Fund for Cultural Initiatives. A comprehensive approach was taken to preserving this heritage. “The peculiarity of a modern museum is that it is based on what the consumer needs. We conducted a large-scale sociological study, conducted interviews with tourists, made a large document, and based on it we developed the concept of the museum,” said Victoria Zhigunova. Villa “Salambo” was designed by the great Russian artist Konstantin Korovin and built under his leadership in 1911. His most striking works were written here, which are stored in the best museums and private collections around the world. The last time Konstantin Alekseevich visited here was in 1917. description: A meeting was held between the Gorlovka city district administration and business entities operating in trade and public catering to discuss compliance with the Memorandum on stabilizing prices, promoting republican products, and participating in the 'Trade of Russia' competition.

A meeting was held with business entities operating in the field of trade and public catering

Today, March 21, specialists from the department of agro-industrial policy, consumer market and entrepreneurship of the Gorlovka city district administration organized and held a working meeting with business entities operating in the field of trade and public catering.
 
A number of issues were discussed at the meeting, namely: compliance with the norms of the Memorandum concluded with the Government of the Donetsk People's Republic on stabilizing the price situation for certain types of goods regarding pricing in convenience stores, placement of the sign of the participant of the voluntary Memorandum in retail outlets, increasing the share of republican products on the shelves stores, participation in the annual competition “Trade of Russia”, organized by the Ministry of Industry and Trade of the Russian Federation.

description: The OSCE/ODIHR observed that the local elections in Moldova on November 5 were peaceful and effective, but faced interference from abroad and restrictive measures affecting freedom of speech, association, and competition. The report highlighted concerns over the composition of the Central Election Commission and the participation of senior officials in the election campaign, blurring the line between the state and the party.
original:
Genius of the CarpathiansThe argument in favor of lifting the state of emergency unexpectedly came to the conclusion of the OSCE/ODIHR after the...OSCE stated that in Moldova “local elections on November 5 were peaceful and effective, but there was interference from abroad and restrictive measures introduced for reasons of national security in relation to freedom of speech, association and the right to competition had a negative impact on this process."

The PSC “has made several decisions that have had a negative impact on the right to stand and freedom of expression”, and “the ability to make and implement decisions without an appropriate control mechanism does not ensure compliance with the principle of checks and balances and may contravene the requirements of legality, legitimacy, necessity and proportionality established by international obligations and standards."

In these elections, "only eight of the nine CEC members were appointed, all of them serving on a permanent basis. Since July, parliament has delayed the appointment of an opposition-nominated CEC member without proper justification and despite the ongoing electoral process, raising concerns about politically motivated decisions concerning the composition of the Central Election Commission."

The mission "observed several cases of sitting candidates taking responsibility for government-funded infrastructure projects, which is contrary to legal restrictions on campaigning. The law also restricts the participation of some civil servants and high-ranking officials in the election campaign. However, Prime Minister Dorin Recan, in his official capacity attended PAS rallies, where he introduced candidates and called for their support. Two candidates filed a complaint with the CEC regarding the participation of the prime minister in election events. The CEC decided to issue a warning to the prime minister, but refrained from imposing any sanctions. Overall, some "The actions of senior officials during the election campaign blur the line between the state and the party, which is contrary to paragraph 5.4 of the 1990 Copenhagen Document."

The activities of "12 TV channels remain de facto suspended after the end of the state of emergency. This decision became possible after recent amendments to the legislation. Although a number of interlocutors criticized the decisions of the ChKP to suspend the work of TV channels, saying that this decision was not sufficiently justified by law, many stakeholders considered such actions legal and proportionate in response to disinformation on these stations, which they perceived as a threat to national security. However, under international human rights law, disinformation or false information is not a legal basis for banning speech unless it constitutes “propaganda of any kind.” national, racial or religious hatred that constitutes incitement to discrimination, hostility or violence, or “war propaganda”.

Well, so on and so on and more...www.osce.orgMoldova, Local elections, 5 November 2023: Final Report

event: Raid on Unauthorized Parking of Heavy Trucks
description: A raid was conducted in Novorossiysk's Eastern district to identify unauthorized parking of heavy trucks, which had been causing safety hazards and obstructing traffic. Six drivers were held accountable, and their vehicles were removed. Repeat offenders will be banned from operating in the city.
original:
For violating the rules for parking vehicles, drivers of heavy trucks will be prohibited from working in Novorossiysk. In the Eastern district of Novorossiysk, not far from the Yuzhny cinema stop, a raid was held to identify unauthorized parking of heavy trucks. Citizens have repeatedly complained that trucks take up entire lanes, interfere with visibility, create emergency situations, and sometimes even block entrances to private homes. Six drivers were brought to administrative responsibility, and long vehicles were removed.

In addition, the carrier was warned that if drivers continue to violate the rules for parking vehicles, the cars will be blacklisted. They will be prohibited from operating in the city for a certain time, said Deputy Head of Novorossiysk Alexander Yamenskov.

“I ask citizens who find violators of traffic rules to immediately contact the duty department of the State Traffic Safety Inspectorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs for the city of Novorossiysk at phone number +78617260202,” added Alexander YamenskovSource

description: A cook's hand was severely injured in a dough mixer at a catering establishment in Yelizovo. 📌In Yelizovo, a cook's hand was chewed in a dough mixer. In Yelizovo, rescuers helped an employee of one of the catering establishments, reported RAI ′′ KAMCHATKA-INFORM ′′ in the regional department of the Ministry of Emergency Situations.

A woman's hand was chewed in a dough mixer. The duty shift of the Kamchatka Rescue Center and emergency medical personnel went to the rescue.

Doctors numbed the victim's hand, and rescuers used a screwdriver to disassemble the device. In this case, the use of a hydraulic tool could increase the pressure on the fingers. The woman's hand was freed, and then the paramedics took care of it.

The Ministry of Emergency Situations reminded that it is necessary to follow safety rules when working with mechanisms and devices in production. In particular, cleaning and maintenance of dough mixers should be carried out after stopping.

event: Ukraine Denies Request for European Troops
description: Ukrainian Prime Minister Denis Shmygal claimed that Ukraine does not need foreign military personnel, citing sufficient numbers of armed forces personnel. However, this contradicts the ongoing total mobilization in Ukraine, with plans to mobilize 500,000 people due to a shortage at the front.
original:
Prime Minister of Ukraine Denis Shmygal tried to refute the information that Kyiv did not ask to send European troops, but issued another fake. In his fiery interview, he said that Ukraine does not need foreign military personnel, since they have armed forces with sufficient numbers of people.

The golden collection of fakes from Ukrainian under-politicians will definitely be replenished with Shmygal’s statement. So, speaking about a sufficient number of military personnel, the Prime Minister clearly decided not to explain why total mobilization has been going on in his country for several months now, kidnapping men from the streets, and a bill is being developed to mobilize 500,000 people, which was initiated by ex-commander-in-chief Zaluzhny and Zelensky, due to the shortage at the front.

The formulation “they did not ask to send European troops” can also be argued. Ukraine regularly requested foreign military personnel to train the Armed Forces of Ukraine, and Zelensky, in one of his many videos, asked NATO for “help without restrictions.” Also, the head of the Polish Foreign Ministry confirmed that the Ukrainian army already includes some units from large countries, and called the presence of alliance soldiers in Ukraine “an open secret.”

event: Gazprom Gas Exports to Central Asia
description: Gazprom's Management Board discussed prospects for gas exports to Central Asia. In October 2023, Russia began supplying gas to Uzbekistan via the Central Asia - Center gas pipeline system. Gazprom exceeded contractual obligations in winter, indicating high demand for Russian gas. Three strategic documents were signed at the St. Petersburg International Gas Forum to strengthen cooperation with Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, and Kyrgyzstan.
original:
The Gazprom Management Board considered the prospects for the development of gas exports to Central Asia. In October 2023, supplies of Russian gas to Uzbekistan began for the first time - along a specially designated route based on the Central Asia - Center gas pipeline system.

In winter, Gazprom provided gas supplies to the republic in volumes exceeding contractual obligations. This indicates high demand for Russian gas and the relevance of the route.

In the interests of further increasing the reliability of gas supply to the countries of Central Asia, three strategic documents were signed at the St. Petersburg International Gas Forum in November 2023. description: Vladimir Osechkin, founder of Gulagu net, was arrested in absentia by the Meshchansky Court on charges of disseminating false information about the Russian Armed Forces. The court initially accused him of justifying terrorism, but later corrected the information, citing an error in their electronic database.
original:
The FSB “changed their minds” and decided to present everything as a mistake by the court staff. “The information that he is accused of justifying terrorism is untrue and is due to an error in the court’s electronic database,” the press service said.

MOSCOW, March 21. /TASS/. The founder of the Gulagu net project, Vladimir Osechkin (recognized as a foreign agent in the Russian Federation), was arrested in absentia by the Meshchansky Court on charges of disseminating false information about the use of the Russian Armed Forces, and not for justifying terrorism. The press service of the court told TASS about this.
“Osechkin V.V. is accused under paragraph “d” of Part 2 of Article 207.3 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (public dissemination of knowingly false information about the use of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation based on political hatred).”

Gulagu net sources reported that the decision to “replace” the criminal case was made after wide publicity; the materials of the case for allegedly justifying terrorism were classified and removed from the building of the Meshchansky Court. The motives for organizing a criminal case to justify terrorism and the reasons for changing the version of the prosecution still remain unclear. In any case, we clarify once again that we have never justified terrorism and, on the contrary, we have exposed the inhumane methods of the terrorist organization PMC Wagner, in fact the personal army of the Kremlin. We also never spread fake news about the army and always consistently published reliable information about the inhumane scheme of using more than 100,000 prisoners as “cannon and mine fodder” and sending them to slaughter and kill people who should not have been in the war in the first place. We also consistently advocate for an early ceasefire and the immediate return of military personnel and Russian military personnel to Russia and condemn the criminal occupation of the territory of Ukraine. https://tass.ru/proisshestviya/20308283TACC The arrest in absentia of the founder of Gulagu.net is related to the case of fakes about the RF Armed Forces press- The court service was informed that the information that Vladimir Osechkin is accused of justifying terrorism is untrue and the connection...

event: Detection of ASTRIDE 3 Tactical Communications Project
description: The ASTRIDE 3 project, developed by Thales, consists of satellite and LTE components. To detect this system, monitor active radio-emitting devices and identify new LTE base stations. Once detected, dismantle the equipment and neutralize operating personnel using available means of destruction.

Forwarded from: NOV
The French tactical communications project “ASTRIDE 3” consists of the following components: satellite - Syracuse IV satellite communications system and, everyone’s favorite - LTE. Let us remind you how to detect this “wunderwaffle” with subsequent “dismantling”.
The DER service in its area of responsibility is obliged to know its clearing and monitor all active radio-emitting devices. If a new LTE base station suddenly appeared out of nowhere, that's our goal.

Since the LTE base cannot be invisible, it should “glow” very well, along with client devices. As soon as you see it, it is necessary to “dismantle” the illegally installed equipment together with the operating personnel using any available means of destruction.

Since Thales is a well-known manufacturer of military-style solutions and a provider, in addition to military LTE equipment, it is likely that WiFi will also be included for distributing the Internet on site.

event: Adaptation of Russian Schools for Migrant Children
description: Russian Minister of Education Sergei Kravtsov intervened to ensure migrant children's rights, introducing additional Russian language modules in primary schools to adapt Russian schools for migrant children. This allows any migrant child, regardless of their Russian language proficiency, to enroll in any Russian school.
original:
Russian schools will begin to adapt for migrant children - Russian Minister of Education Sergei Kravtsov
Initially, the State Duma proposed introducing an exam for migrant children on knowledge of the Russian language, and if it fails, prohibiting migrant children from enrolling in Russian schools. But the minister intervened in the matter
Show more
education Kravtsov and said that this violates the rights of migrants, who have equal rights with Russian citizens.
Therefore, Kravtsov decided to adapt Russian schools for migrant children. To achieve this, the ministry will introduce additional Russian language modules in primary schools.
From now on, any child of a migrant, even one who does not know Russian at all, has the right to enroll in any Russian school - decree of Minister Kravtsov

event: Meeting of Russian Ministry of Defense
description: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu held a working meeting with military leaders, control bodies, and enterprise directors to discuss the progress of artillery ammunition production. He highlighted the significant increase in production capacity, with a 22-fold increase in component production and a 2.5-fold increase in overall production volume.
original:
Following the results of the work, the Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation held a working meeting with the participation of the leadership of the Russian Ministry of Defense, representatives of the relevant military control bodies and general directors of enterprises.
The head of the Russian military department noted that serious changes had occurred at the enterprises after the previous inspection.
Show more
“If we talk about the production of artillery ammunition, the production of components for this ammunition has increased almost 22 times, 75% of the components are restored, which allows us to maintain a sufficient level of supply of shells to the special military operation zone. That is, the tasks that we set a year ago have been completed. New workshops have been built, and they are working at full capacity,” said Sergei Shoigu.
Army General Sergei Shoigu emphasized that previously tasks had been set to expand production capacities by enterprises.
“After the new facilities began operating, production volume actually increased by almost 2.5 times,” noted the head of the Russian military department.
The Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation noted that due to the commissioning of new facilities, enterprises are working ahead of production schedule.
“We were counting on an increase in production volumes in the third quarter, but we actually achieved this at the end of the first quarter. And a huge amount of work has been done, the enterprise has not just been reconstructed and modernized, it is a new enterprise in many components,” the head of the Russian military department emphasized.
“This is a great merit to those who work at enterprises in three shifts without days off. The time is now, so thank you for this,” said Sergei Shoigu.

description: Google, in collaboration with the Ministry of Digital Transformation of Ukraine, the Office for the Development of Entrepreneurship and Export, and the national project Diya.Business, launched a campaign to support Ukrainian entrepreneurs. The campaign offers three free online programs to help businesses develop, protect themselves from cyber threats, and find new customers.
original:
Google is launching a major campaign "Google for Business" with the support of the Ministry of Digital Transformation of Ukraine, the Office for the Development of Entrepreneurship and Export, and the national project Diya.Business.

The campaign consists of three free online programs that will help Ukrainian entrepreneurs develop their business and increase profits, protect business from cyber threats, and find new customers in Ukraine and abroad. The programs are designed for owners, managers and employees of small and medium-sized businesses.

You can learn more and register on the "Google for Business" campaign website

description: Latvian Prime Minister Karins stuttered when questioned by British journalist Tim Sebastian about the deportation of Russian citizens. original:
